analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di @194a * //
translated: The condensed meaning of this is as follows.

original: yin te / gal te khyed cag gi don dam pa pa'i sgra dang don dag gi brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur bar byed na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: yin te / gal te khyed cag gi don dam pa pa'i sgra dang don dag gi brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur bar byed na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If you are trying to show that the ultimate term and meaning are not the referent and the referent designator, then you are proving what is already established.

original: 'di ltar rigs dang rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i brjod par bya ba dang brjod par byed pa nyid rgyas par sgra'i don brtags par bsal zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs dang rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i brjod par bya ba dang brjod par byed pa nyid rgyas par sgra'i don brtags par bsal zin to //
translated: For thus the referent and referent designator of such things as the universal and intrinsic identity have already been refuted in the examination of the referent of terms.

original: ci ste kun rdzob tu yang yin na de'i tshe ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci ste kun rdzob tu yang yin na de'i tshe ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if you are saying this conventionally, then your argument is inconclusive.

original: 'di ltar shin tu tha dad pa yin na yang don 'ga' zhig rang bzhin gyis rnam par gcig tu rtog pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du bsgrub pas na kun rdzob kyi sgra dang don dag gi brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos po bsgrub par
analyzed: 'di ltar shin tu tha dad pa yin na yang don 'ga' zhig rang bzhin gyis rnam par gcig tu rtog pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du bsgrub pas na kun rdzob kyi sgra dang don dag gi brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos po bsgrub par
translated: Thus, although they are utterly distinct, since the meaning is established as the cause of the cognition that conceives of some object as intrinsically one, the expressed meaning and the expression are established as the things that express and that are expressed.

original: 'gyur ro zhes dang po nyid du gzhan sel bar bsam par bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes dang po nyid du gzhan sel bar bsam par bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, the expression â€œexclusionâ€ was first taught to be the referent of words.

original: de lta bas na sel ba sgra'i don du smra ba'i sangs rgyas pa rnams la brjod pa 'di thams cad shin tu gsog pa yin pas gting ma tshugs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu rjod par byed pa nyid 'thad par 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na sel ba sgra'i don du smra ba'i sangs rgyas pa rnams la brjod pa 'di thams cad shin tu gsog pa yin pas gting ma tshugs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu rjod par byed pa nyid 'thad par 'chad pa ni /
translated: Therefore, since all of these expressions are utterly meaningless for the Buddhists who propound that exclusion is the referent of words, since they are only a meaningless jumble, the explanation that it is tenable that they are expressions of the conventional is as follows.

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa 'di //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa 'di //
translated: The cognition that arises from words

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: gang gi tshe blo rang gi snang ba'i sgo nas gzhan gyi ngo bo sgrib par byed pa ni don ci lta ba bzhin du mi snang ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo de kun rdzob yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe blo rang gi snang ba'i sgo nas gzhan gyi ngo bo sgrib par byed pa ni don ci lta ba bzhin du mi snang ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo de kun rdzob yin la /
translated: When the mind obscures the nature of something through its own appearance, it does not appear as it really is. Therefore, the conceptual mind is the superficial.

original: de rnam par gzhag pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob ces bya'o //
analyzed: de rnam par gzhag pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob ces bya'o //
translated: The nature of its establishment is called the superficial.

original: de nyid kyang kun rdzob tu yod pa yin te /ğŸ”½de'i phyir des rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir sgra dang don dag gis brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa nyid du kun rdzob nyid du gnas pa yin gyi /ğŸ”½don dam pa pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyang kun rdzob tu yod pa yin te / de'i phyir des rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir sgra dang don dag gis brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa nyid du kun rdzob nyid du gnas pa yin gyi / don dam pa pa ni ma yin te /
translated: That is also superficially existent.

original: de med pa'i phyir dang 'khrul ba'i shes pa thams cad yul med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir dang 'khrul ba'i shes pa thams cad yul med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because it is established by that, the expressed and the expresser are only superficially, not ultimately, because of the nonexistence of that and because all erroneous consciousnesses are devoid of objects.

original: ci ste don dam pa'i gcig pa nyid yin na yang sgra rnams ji ltar sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad sgro btags pa'i dbang gis sgrub par byed snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste don dam pa'i gcig pa nyid yin na yang sgra rnams ji ltar sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad sgro btags pa'i dbang gis sgrub par byed snyam na /
translated: But if they are ultimately identical, how can words be established by the power of the superimposition of the conventions of affirmation and negation?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To this he says, â€œIn this way, etc.â€

original: lag brda la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas mig brda la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: lag brda la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas mig brda la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: â€œSign language, etc.â€ includes eye signals, etc.

original: myur ba dang dal ba'i bye brag la sogs pa'i bye brag gis blo tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: myur ba dang dal ba'i bye brag la sogs pa'i bye brag gis blo tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Because of the difference in cognition due to the difference of speed and slowness, etc.

original: myur ba la sogs pa'i bye brag 'di gsal bar byed pas byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: myur ba la sogs pa'i bye brag 'di gsal bar byed pas byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This difference of speed, etc. is not produced by the manifestation,

original: gsal ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because manifestation has been refuted.

original: de'i gsal ba zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gsal ba zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i gsal ba'o //
translated: â€œIts manifestationâ€ means the manifestation of the permanent.

original: spyi'i dbang gi tha snyad kyi @194b yan lag nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi'i dbang gi tha snyad kyi @194b yan lag nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a part of the convention of the universal,

original: de ni bkag zin pa'i phyir dang ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bkag zin pa'i phyir dang ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that has been refuted and is not understood.

original: spyi ni tha snyad kyi yan lag nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi ni tha snyad kyi yan lag nyid ma yin te /
translated: The universal is not a part of the convention itself,

original: thams cad kyi tshe tha snyad du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe tha snyad du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be a convention at all times.

original: brda ni bgag pa la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: brda ni bgag pa la sogs pa'i //
translated: Convention is a sign, etc.

original: zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras sgrub par byed pa dang rjes su gnang ba dang don du gnyer ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras sgrub par byed pa dang rjes su gnang ba dang don du gnyer ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word â€œetc.â€ in the expression â€œa sign, etc.â€ includes affirmation, permission, desire, etc.

original: de dag gi shes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi shes pa ste /
translated: It is the cognition of these.

original: rtogs pa de'i yan lag ste rgyur lag brda la sogs pa 'di 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa de'i yan lag ste rgyur lag brda la sogs pa 'di 'gyur ro //
translated: The sign, etc. are a part, i.e., a cause, of the understanding, i.e., the cognition of these.

original: de bzhin du sgra yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: Sound is also like this.

original: de'i phyir sgra don gyis 'brel ba //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra don gyis 'brel ba //
translated: Therefore, the connection of sound and meaning is

original: rtag pa nyid du khas blang gis //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du khas blang gis //
translated: accepted as permanent.

original: zhes gang smras pa de la sgra 'di dag ni phyi rol don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /ğŸ”½gang zhig rtag pa'am /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de la sgra 'di dag ni phyi rol don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang zhig rtag pa'am /
translated: In response to this, DignÄga says, â€œThese sounds, etc.â€

original: mi rtag par 'gyur ba sgra dang don dag gi 'brel ba dngos po pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag par 'gyur ba sgra dang don dag gi 'brel ba dngos po pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no real connection between sound and meaning that would be either permanent or impermanent.

original: 'di ltar sgra rnams phyi rol gyi don rtogs par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra rnams phyi rol gyi don rtogs par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, words do not reveal external objects.

original: de dang lhan cig 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar sgra'i don brtags par bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar sgra'i don brtags par bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained this in the examination of the meaning of words, where we said that words do not reveal external objects because they are not related to them.

original: 'brel ba med par yang ston par byed pa na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba med par yang ston par byed pa na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that words reveal objects even though they are not related to them, then anything could reveal anything.

original: 'o na de lta na ci zhig ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na ci zhig ston par byed ce na /
translated: If that is so, then what do words reveal?

original: brjod par 'dod pa ston pa yin //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa ston pa yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They reveal what is intended to be expressed.

original: brjod par 'dod pa yang brjod par bya ba nyid kyis ston pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa yang brjod par bya ba nyid kyis ston pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Words do not reveal what is intended to be expressed by virtue of being the object expressed.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rtags nyid kyis ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rtags nyid kyis ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: They reveal it by virtue of being a sign.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ston pa yin //ğŸ”½zhes bshad do //ğŸ”½'di ltar sgra brjod pa las don nges pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye'i /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ston pa yin // zhes bshad do // 'di ltar sgra brjod pa las don nges pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye'i /
translated: Therefore, they reveal it.

original: brjod par 'dod pa nges pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa nges pa ni ma yin la /
translated: Thus, a conception that ascertains an object arises from the expression of a word, but the intended expression is not ascertained.

original: sgra'i shes pas ma nges pa gang yin pa de yang ji ltar sgra'i don yin /
analyzed: sgra'i shes pas ma nges pa gang yin pa de yang ji ltar sgra'i don yin /
translated: And how could that which is not ascertained by the cognition of a word be the meaning of the word?

original: gal te de lta na gang gi rtags kyis de ston par byed pa brjod par 'dod pa dang lhan cig de dang 'brel ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na gang gi rtags kyis de ston par byed pa brjod par 'dod pa dang lhan cig de dang 'brel ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what is the reason for teaching that?

original: de dag de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, â€œThose are its results,â€ etc.

original: sgra rnams brjod par 'dod pa de'i 'bras bu nyid du bdag nyid la mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis nges pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid 'brel ba yin no //
analyzed: sgra rnams brjod par 'dod pa de'i 'bras bu nyid du bdag nyid la mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis nges pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid 'brel ba yin no //
translated: The words are the results of the desire to speak, because they are ascertained by perception and non-apprehension as the nature of cause and effect.

original: 'o na de ltar na brda don med de /ğŸ”½mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa kho na las rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar na brda don med de / mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa kho na las rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the sign is meaningless,

original: gang gis rgyu dang 'bras bu yi //
analyzed: gang gis rgyu dang 'bras bu yi //
translated: because the thing that is the cause and effect is ascertained just from perception and non-apprehension.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, â€œThe sign is not meaningless,â€ etc.

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks as follows.

original: gal te yang brjod par 'dod pa tsam du lhan cig rgyu @195a * //
analyzed: gal te yang brjod par 'dod pa tsam du lhan cig rgyu @195a * //
translated: Even though the desire to speak is the cause of the words, the words are not the cause of the desire to speak.

original: dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid kyis nges te brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par dang ni gzhan gyi rgyud las brda las ma gtogs pa nges par mi nus pas de'i phyir de nges par bya ba'i phyir brda byed do //
analyzed: dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid kyis nges te brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par dang ni gzhan gyi rgyud las brda las ma gtogs pa nges par mi nus pas de'i phyir de nges par bya ba'i phyir brda byed do //
translated: But if it is not possible to ascertain the specific object that one wishes to express from the continuum of another, then in order to ascertain it, one would make a sign.

original: 'on te brda las kyang ci ltar 'di nges par nus te /
analyzed: 'on te brda las kyang ci ltar 'di nges par nus te /
translated: But how could it be possible to ascertain it from a sign?

original: 'di ltar brda'i dus na gzhan gyi brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par srid par gyur na de'i tshe de la /
analyzed: 'di ltar brda'i dus na gzhan gyi brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par srid par gyur na de'i tshe de la /
translated: For example, at the time of making a sign, if the specific object that one wishes to express is possible, then at that time,

original: brda 'di byas pa na phyis tha snyad kyi dus na brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par rtog pa'i rgyur 'gyur na gang gi phyir thabs de nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: brda 'di byas pa na phyis tha snyad kyi dus na brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par rtog pa'i rgyur 'gyur na gang gi phyir thabs de nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: when the sign is made, later at the time of using the convention, the specific object that one wishes to express would be the cause of conception. But that method does not exist.

original: de lta na yang sgra brjod nas brda byed la /
analyzed: de lta na yang sgra brjod nas brda byed la /
translated: Even so, one makes a sign after uttering a word.

original: de lta yin dang sgra de nyid las brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par rtogs pan phan tshun bsten pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang sgra de nyid las brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par rtogs pan phan tshun bsten pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, then the specific object that one wishes to express would be understood from that word itself, and the error of mutual dependence would ensue.

original: 'di ltar brda'i dbang gis sgra brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par gsal bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar brda'i dbang gis sgra brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par gsal bar byed pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the difference that is the object of the desire to speak is clarified by the power of the sign.

original: sgra yang brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par rtogs pa med par sgra las ma yin pa'i phyir phan tshun bsten pa nyid du gsal ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: sgra yang brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par rtogs pa med par sgra las ma yin pa'i phyir phan tshun bsten pa nyid du gsal ba'o zhe na /
translated: And since the word is not from the word without the difference that is the object of the desire to speak, it is clear that they mutually depend.

original: skyon 'di ni med de /
analyzed: skyon 'di ni med de /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: sgra'i tha snyad 'di thams cad rang gi snang ba'i rjes su byed pa nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: sgra'i tha snyad 'di thams cad rang gi snang ba'i rjes su byed pa nyid du 'dod de /
translated: We assert that all these conventions of words are just in accordance with their appearance.

original: 'khrul ba'i rab rib can gnyis kyi zla ba gnyis kyi tha snyad lta bu yin pa de'i tshe brtsad du ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i rab rib can gnyis kyi zla ba gnyis kyi tha snyad lta bu yin pa de'i tshe brtsad du ci zhig yod /
translated: When it is like the convention of two moons for one with diseased vision, what is there to dispute?

original: thams cad du sgra nyid thams cad brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad du sgra nyid thams cad brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the word itself is the cause of the understanding of the difference that is the object of the desire to speak in all cases.

original: gzhan du yang la lar nas bzung nas sam /
analyzed: gzhan du yang la lar nas bzung nas sam /
translated: In other cases, it is sometimes from the word naá¸¥, and sometimes from the word naá¸¥.

original: skabs la sogs pas don gyi khyad par ston pas rang gi brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par rigs nas brda byed pa'i phan tshun bsten pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: skabs la sogs pas don gyi khyad par ston pas rang gi brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par rigs nas brda byed pa'i phan tshun bsten pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The words â€œat that timeâ€ and so on indicate a particular meaning, so the word is not a mere conventional sign that arises from the particular thing that one wishes to express.

original: gzhan yang khyed cag bsgrub par smra ba la yang klan ka mtshungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed cag bsgrub par smra ba la yang klan ka mtshungs te /
translated: Moreover, the same objection applies to your assertion that the word is a means of proof.

original: gzhan gyi rtogs pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rtogs pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the understanding of others is not directly perceived.

original: ji ltar smra ba po dang nyan pa po dag don gcig rtogs par nges pa med par brda rigs pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar smra ba po dang nyan pa po dag don gcig rtogs par nges pa med par brda rigs pa yin /
translated: How can the word be a conventional sign when there is no certainty that the speaker and the hearer understand the same thing?

original: de lta bas na 'di la khyed kyi lan gang yin pa de kho bo cag gir yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di la khyed kyi lan gang yin pa de kho bo cag gir yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, whatever answer you give to this objection will also be our answer.

original: 'di snyam du sgra brjod par 'dod pa la brda ma byas pa'i phyir de ji ltar brda las de dang lhan cig 'brel ba nges par byed /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sgra brjod par 'dod pa la brda ma byas pa'i phyir de ji ltar brda las de dang lhan cig 'brel ba nges par byed /
translated: If you think that the word is not a conventional sign because it does not express what is intended, then how can it be ascertained that it is related to that?

original: gzhan la brda byas pas ni don gzhan gsal bar byed par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la brda byas pas ni don gzhan gsal bar byed par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the word expresses another meaning because it is a conventional sign for that.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: Because that would lead to an absurd conclusion.

original: skyon 'di ni med de /
analyzed: skyon 'di ni med de /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: 'dir sgras brjod par 'dod pa la yongs su gsal ba don gyi rnam pa phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid nges par byas pa gang yin pa de 'dir 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dir sgras brjod par 'dod pa la yongs su gsal ba don gyi rnam pa phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid nges par byas pa gang yin pa de 'dir 'dod de /
translated: Here, what is intended to be expressed by the word is the ascertainment of the external nature, the aspect of the object that is completely clear.

original: de ni dam par brjod @195b par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dam par brjod @195b par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the nature of what is intended to be expressed.

original: de nyid 'dir brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par du 'dod cing /
analyzed: de nyid 'dir brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par du 'dod cing /
translated: That itself is accepted as the particular that is intended to be expressed here.

original: de nyid la brda byed pa yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid la brda byed pa yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is that itself to which the sign refers, not to the intrinsic identity.

original: de nyid sgra brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid sgra brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: That itself is what is to be expressed by the word.

original: de las de'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir brjod par 'dod pa 'ba' zhig sgras brjod pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de las de'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir brjod par 'dod pa 'ba' zhig sgras brjod pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that only what is intended to be expressed is expressed by the word, because the conception having the aspect of that arises from that.

original: de lta na gal te brjod par 'dod pa la yongs su gsal ba la don gyi rnam pas sgra'i 'brel ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kho na yin na de ji ltar slob dpon gyis de dang der sgra dang don gyi 'brel ba brda las byung ba'am
analyzed: de lta na gal te brjod par 'dod pa la yongs su gsal ba la don gyi rnam pas sgra'i 'brel ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kho na yin na de ji ltar slob dpon gyis de dang der sgra dang don gyi 'brel ba brda las byung ba'am
translated: How is it that the Master has said in such and such a place that the connection between the word and its meaning is conventional,

original: / brda yin par gsungs she na /
analyzed: / brda yin par gsungs she na /
translated: or that it is a convention?

original: brjod par 'dod la gsal don dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod la gsal don dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse says: â€œIn order to make oneself understood, one uses a word whose meaning is well known.â€

original: brda yod na nyan pa po'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir brda las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: brda yod na nyan pa po'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir brda las byung ba yin no //
translated: Since the knowledge of the hearer arises when there is a convention, the connection is conventional.

original: bdag nyid la sogs pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir thag ces bya ba ni skyon sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid la sogs pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir thag ces bya ba ni skyon sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word â€œconventionâ€ should be understood as a fault, because it is a matter of oneself, etc.

original: gal te yang der yang pa'i sgra ni don brjod pa'i tshig tu gzung bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te yang der yang pa'i sgra ni don brjod pa'i tshig tu gzung bar bya ba yin la /
translated: Moreover, the word â€œconventionâ€ should be understood as a word that expresses a meaning.

original: de lta na'ang don dam par yod pa dang skye ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir de nyid brjod par 'dod pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na'ang don dam par yod pa dang skye ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir de nyid brjod par 'dod pa yod pa yin no //
translated: Even so, since existence and origination are not different in the ultimate, it is the existence that is intended to be expressed.

original: smra ba po'i rgyud la yang brda'i sgo nas gsal bar byed pa'i phyir nye bar btags nas brda yin par brjod de /
analyzed: smra ba po'i rgyud la yang brda'i sgo nas gsal bar byed pa'i phyir nye bar btags nas brda yin par brjod de /
translated: and in the speaker's mind-stream, it is made clear by means of the sign, so it is called a sign by designation.

original: de ni so sor nges pa'i dus su 'jug pa nyid kyis de'i dus su mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni so sor nges pa'i dus su 'jug pa nyid kyis de'i dus su mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, it is just at the time of the individual's ascertainment that it is impossible at that time.

original: 'on te gal te don dam par dngos por gyur pa'i 'brel ba med ces bya ba bstan pa ma yin nam //
analyzed: 'on te gal te don dam par dngos por gyur pa'i 'brel ba med ces bya ba bstan pa ma yin nam //
translated: But, if it is not taught that ultimately there is no connection that is a thing,

original: 'o na ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur zhe na /ğŸ”½rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur ba yi //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur zhe na / rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur ba yi //
translated: then how can it be the definition of cause and effect?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The statement that which is called cause and effect and so on is for the purpose of making the meaning brief.

original: de dag nyid ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The statement those two refers to the things that are cause and effect.

original: de skad ces bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshogs chung bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshogs chung bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: The statement that is called and so on is for the purpose of making the meaning brief by means of the words cause and effect and so on.

original: de ltar na yang skyes bu dang sbyor ba re re la de dag tha dad pa'i phyir ji ltar smra ba po dang nyan pa po dag gi 'brel ba tha mi dad par rtogs //
analyzed: de ltar na yang skyes bu dang sbyor ba re re la de dag tha dad pa'i phyir ji ltar smra ba po dang nyan pa po dag gi 'brel ba tha mi dad par rtogs //
translated: But even so, since the person and the application are different, how is the connection between the speaker and the hearer understood to be non-different?

original: 'di ltar smra ba po 'di snyam du /ğŸ”½brda'i dus su bdag gis bzung ba gang yin pa'i sgra'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar smra ba po 'di snyam du / brda'i dus su bdag gis bzung ba gang yin pa'i sgra'am /
translated: In this way, the speaker thinks,

original: don de nyid kyis don de nyid rtogs par bya'o snyam du sems la /
analyzed: don de nyid kyis don de nyid rtogs par bya'o snyam du sems la /
translated: â€œI will make the hearer understand the meaning by means of the sound that I have grasped at the time of the convention.â€

original: de bzhin du nyan pa po yang 'di snyam du de nyid kyis don de nyid rtogs par byed do snyam ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan pa po yang 'di snyam du de nyid kyis don de nyid rtogs par byed do snyam ste /
translated: And the hearer also thinks, â€œI will understand the meaning by means of that.â€

original: de ma yin na blo tha dad pa la gnas pa dag ji ltar tha snyad du byed par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ma yin na blo tha dad pa la gnas pa dag ji ltar tha snyad du byed par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it were not so, how could those who are situated in different minds make conventions?ğŸ”½To explain this, he says,

original: de dag kyang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag kyang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œThey are also confusedâ€ and so on.

original: rmongs par zhes bya ba ni @196a * //
analyzed: rmongs par zhes bya ba ni @196a * //
translated: â€œConfusedâ€ means

original: 'khrul pas so //
analyzed: 'khrul pas so //
translated: mistaken.ğŸ”½â€œUnderstandâ€ means

original: rtogs zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: grasp.

original: 'di ni brda dang tha snyad dag gis phyin pa ste non pa yang yin la dus kyang yin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brda dang tha snyad dag gis phyin pa ste non pa yang yin la dus kyang yin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is so called because it is the time that is traversed by the words and conventions.

original: der khyad par ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo gcig gis zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: der khyad par ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo gcig gis zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The difference there is that it is by a single entity that is both cause and effect.ğŸ”½Moreover, why is a single relation not accepted in the ultimate? Why is only the imagined accepted?

original: yang don dam par 'brel ba gcig nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'dod gang gis brtags pa kho na 'dod ce na 'di la 'brel ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang don dam par 'brel ba gcig nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'dod gang gis brtags pa kho na 'dod ce na 'di la 'brel ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In this regard, he says, â€œIf there were a relation,â€ etc.

original: 'brel ba yod na tha dad pa rnams la yod dam tha mi dad pa rnams la yod grang /
analyzed: 'brel ba yod na tha dad pa rnams la yod dam tha mi dad pa rnams la yod grang /
translated: If there were a relation, would it exist in different things or in non-different things?

original: re zhig tha dad pa rnams la ni med de /
analyzed: re zhig tha dad pa rnams la ni med de /
translated: First, it does not exist in different things.

original: thams cad rang gi bdag nyid la gnas pa nyid kyis ma 'chol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad rang gi bdag nyid la gnas pa nyid kyis ma 'chol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all things are unmixed, each abiding in its own nature.

original: tha mi dad pa na yang dngos po de gcig kho na yin pa'i phyir gang zhig gang dang lhan cig 'brel par 'gyur /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa na yang dngos po de gcig kho na yin pa'i phyir gang zhig gang dang lhan cig 'brel par 'gyur /
translated: If they are not different, then that thing is only one, so what would be related to what?

original: de'i phyir ma 'brel pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'brel pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there would be no relation.

original: gang du brda'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa'i brda ni skyes bu so so la'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa de la grub pa la sgrub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang du brda'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa'i brda ni skyes bu so so la'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa de la grub pa la sgrub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that this response is pointless, the Commentary says:

original: brda ni skyes bu so so la //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brda ni skyes bu so so la // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The convention is in the individual person.

original: 'di mi 'dod pa'i thog tu gtong ba ni sun 'byin pa zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas pa dag gis brda sgra don dag gi 'brel ba dngos po bar ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di mi 'dod pa'i thog tu gtong ba ni sun 'byin pa zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas pa dag gis brda sgra don dag gi 'brel ba dngos po bar ni mi 'dod de /
translated: The opponentâ€™s response is pointless because the Buddhist does not accept that the connection between the signifier and the signified is a real entity.

original: de ni skyes bu'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skyes bu'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is a property of a person.

original: de sun 'byin pa na yang 'dod pa nyams pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de sun 'byin pa na yang 'dod pa nyams pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: So when the Buddhist refutes this, the opponentâ€™s position is undermined.

original: gzhan gyi chos gzhan gyis 'brel bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi chos gzhan gyis 'brel bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that one thing is connected to another thing.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: brjod pa re re nyid la'am /
analyzed: brjod pa re re nyid la'am /
translated: The opponent says, â€œThe connection is in each individual expression.â€

original: 'gro ba'i dang por lan cig zhig / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i phyogs gnyis smras pa gang yin pa de yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i dang por lan cig zhig / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i phyogs gnyis smras pa gang yin pa de yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa ma yin no //
translated: The two positions that were stated, â€œfirst of all, onceâ€ and so on, are not refuted because they are not accepted.

original: brjod pa re re zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: brjod pa re re zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: In response to the statement, â€œEach expression . . . ,â€

original: de lta'i zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: de lta'i zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba'o //
translated: â€œThusâ€ indicates a connection.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pas so //
translated: â€œAnotherâ€ is a Buddhist.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'o //ğŸ”½'brel ba re re tha dad dam //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'o // 'brel ba re re tha dad dam //
translated: â€œÄªÅ›vara and so onâ€ is ÄªÅ›vara, BrahmÄ, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: In response to the statement, â€œEach connection is different . . . ,â€

original: re re'i 'brel ba gang yin de //
analyzed: re re'i 'brel ba gang yin de //
translated: â€œWhat is the connection of each?â€

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on is stated.

original: 'dir ni phyogs gnyis pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'dir ni phyogs gnyis pa nyid yin la /
translated: Here, the second position is true.

original: blo tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: blo tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not the case that it follows that there would be different minds,

original: tha dad kyang 'dra bar rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid mi 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tha dad kyang 'dra bar rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid mi 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: because even though they are different, there is no contradiction that they are the cause of the cognition of similarity.

original: gal te tha dad blo tha dad //
analyzed: gal te tha dad blo tha dad //
translated: If different, there would be different minds.

original: ces gang smras pa de ni ma nges pa @196b yin no //
analyzed: ces gang smras pa de ni ma nges pa @196b yin no //
translated: But that which you have said is not certain.

original: 'di snyam du kho bo cag la skad cig ma 'jig pa ma grub pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½tha dad skad cig gis 'jig phyir //
analyzed: 'di snyam du kho bo cag la skad cig ma 'jig pa ma grub pa'i phyir / tha dad skad cig gis 'jig phyir //
translated: If you think: â€œFor us, the momentariness of destruction is not established.

original: zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: Therefore, how can we say: â€˜Because of the momentariness of differenceâ€™?â€

original: rim gyis kyang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rim gyis kyang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [We reply:] â€œEven if it is gradual,â€ and so on.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba'i rim pa brjod de ston par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //ğŸ”½gzhan du de dag rim mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba'i rim pa brjod de ston par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // gzhan du de dag rim mi 'gyur //
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to the sequence of connection, which is to say, it is the explanation, the teaching.

original: zhes bya ba ni blo rnams zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni blo rnams zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: â€œOtherwise, they would not be sequential,â€ is to be connected with â€œthe cognitions.â€

original: 'di yang zlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang zlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin te /
translated: This is also a valid refutation of the opposite position.

original: sbyor ba ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //ğŸ”½smra bo nyan pa'i blo tha dad //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o // smra bo nyan pa'i blo tha dad //
translated: The syllogism should be stated as before.

original: phyir na tha snyad 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: phyir na tha snyad 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: â€œThe convention would be destroyed because the cognitions of the speaker and the hearer are different,â€ and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs la mang po rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs la mang po rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [We reply:] â€œMany,â€ and so on.

original: dper na sngon po la sogs pa'i skad cig ma mang po dag gis mthong na yang tha dad pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na sngon po la sogs pa'i skad cig ma mang po dag gis mthong na yang tha dad pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, even though many moments of blue, etc. are seen, they are not different.

original: mang po rnams brda byed na yang 'brel ba tha dad pa ma yin na gnyis lta smos kyang ci dgos //
analyzed: mang po rnams brda byed na yang 'brel ba tha dad pa ma yin na gnyis lta smos kyang ci dgos //
translated: In the same way, even though many [words] are used to make a convention, there is no difference in the connection, much less [difference] in two [words].

original: thams cad 'dra bar rtogs pa la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad 'dra bar rtogs pa la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that it is because all [words] are understood in the same way.

original: de'i phyir smra ba po dang nyan pa po dag la 'brel pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir smra ba po dang nyan pa po dag la 'brel pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no other connection for the speaker and listener.

original: bum pa sogs la mtshungs she na //
analyzed: bum pa sogs la mtshungs she na //
translated: If it is said that it is the same for pots, etc.,

original: ma yin spyi ni rab grub phyir //
analyzed: ma yin spyi ni rab grub phyir //
translated: No, because the universal is well established.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: This is what was said.

original: bum sogs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bum sogs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, [the root text] says pots, etc.

original: dang po nyid du zhes bya ba ni spyi brtags par ro //
analyzed: dang po nyid du zhes bya ba ni spyi brtags par ro //
translated: First of all means in the case of the imagined universal.

original: yang 'di nyid du bsdus nas bsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'byung po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang 'di nyid du bsdus nas bsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'byung po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to summarize this very point and to clarify it, [the root text] says elemental spirits, etc.

original: 'byung bo rnams nyi ma la sogs pa'i gza' rnams kyi mgul chings bzhin du khyed cag spyod pa ba rnams kyi rigs tha dad par mi 'dod la bltar rung ba nyid yin pa ni snang ba yang ma yin zhing tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung bo rnams nyi ma la sogs pa'i gza' rnams kyi mgul chings bzhin du khyed cag spyod pa ba rnams kyi rigs tha dad par mi 'dod la bltar rung ba nyid yin pa ni snang ba yang ma yin zhing tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: You do not assert that the elements are like the muklacchakas of the planets, the sun and so on, that they are different types of behavior, nor that they are visible, nor that they are not different.

original: rigs kyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa de dag kyang rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa de dag kyang rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But it follows that they are permanent, like the essence of the type, because of the reason stated above.

original: ci ste yang tha dad par khas len na de'i tshe 'brel ba med pa'i nyes pa dang tha dad pa rnams kyi 'brel ba ni de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste yang tha dad par khas len na de'i tshe 'brel ba med pa'i nyes pa dang tha dad pa rnams kyi 'brel ba ni de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: But if you accept that they are different, then the error of their being unrelated arises, and the relation of different things is only the characteristic of arising from that.

original: de lta yin dang de las byung ba yin na rigs mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang de las byung ba yin na rigs mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then because of arising from that, the type would be impermanent,

original: skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no //
translated: because it would have the property of being produced, like a pot.

original: la lar rtag pa nyid ces 'dod pa der ni don 'di yin te /
analyzed: la lar rtag pa nyid ces 'dod pa der ni don 'di yin te /
translated: In some places, permanence is asserted, and in that case, this is the meaning.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa rigs de las skye bar khas len par byed na /ğŸ”½de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa rigs de las skye bar khas len par byed na / de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that a pot and so on arises from that type,

original: rgyu nye ba'i phyir rtag tu skye bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu nye ba'i phyir rtag tu skye bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then at that time a pot and so on would be permanent because it would always arise due to the proximity of its cause.

original: gnyi ga'i @197a * //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i @197a * //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rang bzhin yin pa'i phyogs la gnyi ga'i phyogs las byung ba'i skyon dang gcig nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin yin pa'i phyogs la gnyi ga'i phyogs las byung ba'i skyon dang gcig nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: In the case of the position that it has the nature of both, the error that arises from both positions and the error that it is not one would ensue.

original: dngos po gcig la rang bzhin gnyis mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la rang bzhin gnyis mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is untenable that a single thing has two natures.

original: de lta na'ang dngos po gcig nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur gyi gcig gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na'ang dngos po gcig nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur gyi gcig gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Even so, it would be accepted that it is a single thing, but it is not that one is the nature of both.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyogs la dngos po nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba dang gcig la bsgrub pa dang dgag pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyogs la dngos po nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba dang gcig la bsgrub pa dang dgag pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the case of the position that it is neither, the error that it would not be a thing would ensue and it would be illogical to affirm and negate one thing.

original: nyes pa 'di dag ces bya ba ni 'brel ba mi sgrub pa dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di dag ces bya ba ni 'brel ba mi sgrub pa dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: These faults are the characteristics of the consequence of non-establishment of the relation, impermanence, etc.

original: chu 'dzin la sogs pa 'bras bu rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba yang skyon bla lhag pa yin no //
analyzed: chu 'dzin la sogs pa 'bras bu rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba yang skyon bla lhag pa yin no //
translated: The consequence of the permanence of the effect, such as the cloud, etc., is also a fault.

original: 'brel ba nus pa nyid yin te //
analyzed: 'brel ba nus pa nyid yin te //
translated: The relation is the capacity.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: This is what was said.

original: 'brel ba'ang nus pa nyid yin la //
analyzed: 'brel ba'ang nus pa nyid yin la //
translated: The relation is the capacity.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is what was said.

original: mi 'dod ce na 'di bya ba ni gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid la snga ma bzhin du skyon du thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dod ce na 'di bya ba ni gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid la snga ma bzhin du skyon du thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not accepted, then the activity has the characteristic of the nature of both and neither, and the consequence of the fault as before arises.ğŸ”½This is what was said.

original: 'brel pa brjod pa'i dus su yang //
analyzed: 'brel pa brjod pa'i dus su yang //
translated: If the relation is expressed,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: This is what was said.

original: 'brel pa brjod pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'brel pa brjod pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If the relation is expressed, etc. is stated.

original: ci 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid de 'dra ba'i 'brel ba yod pa de'i phyir kha cig rtogs so zhes rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid de 'dra ba'i 'brel ba yod pa de'i phyir kha cig rtogs so zhes rigs pa yin te /
translated: â€œWhat kind of?â€ means that because there is a connection of that kind, which is the characteristic of cause and effect, therefore it is reasonable to say that â€œsomeâ€ are understood.

original: de ni so sor nges pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni so sor nges pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it is established as the producer of a cognition that is individually certain.

original: khyed cag gi 'brel ba la thams cad rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni khyed cag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyed cag gi 'brel ba la thams cad rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni khyed cag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To show that your connection is not reasonable in every way, he says, â€œBut for you, etc.â€

original: 'di ltar 'brel ba ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod la skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo yang nus pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'brel ba ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod la skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo yang nus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, connection is asserted to have the characteristic of potentiality, and the nature of a producer is called â€œpotentiality.â€

original: de yang rtag pa dang gcig pu'i rang bzhin dang don rtogs pa skyed par byed pa la nges par 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang rtag pa dang gcig pu'i rang bzhin dang don rtogs pa skyed par byed pa la nges par 'dod do //
translated: And that is asserted to be certain in the production of the understanding of a permanent, unitary nature and of an object.

original: de lta na don rtogs pa la nges pa yin na skyes bu nyung zad kyi mtshams dang 'bral ba mtshams med par 'dod dam /
analyzed: de lta na don rtogs pa la nges pa yin na skyes bu nyung zad kyi mtshams dang 'bral ba mtshams med par 'dod dam /
translated: If that is so, then if it is certain in the production of the understanding of an object, is it asserted that a few people are separated from the boundary of the hells and attain the boundary of the highest heaven?

original: 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis so //
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis so //
translated: It is not so.

original: phyogs dang po la thams cad la thams cad cig car don rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs dang po la thams cad la thams cad cig car don rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the first position, it follows that all things would simultaneously comprehend all objects.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang so sor nges pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin nges pa'i rgyu brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang so sor nges pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin nges pa'i rgyu brjod par bya ste /
translated: In the second position, you must state the cause of the certainty of the nature that produces the individually certain cognition.

original: dngos po byas pa rnams ni so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin nges pa ni rang gi rgyu dang @197b rkyen rnams yin par rigs te /
analyzed: dngos po byas pa rnams ni so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin nges pa ni rang gi rgyu dang @197b rkyen rnams yin par rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable that the cause of the certainty of the nature that produces the individually certain effect of created things is their own causes and conditions.

original: rtag pa rnams ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa rnams ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It is not so for permanent things.

original: 'di snyam du rtag pa rnams kyang gang gis so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed kyi thams cad ma yin pa de 'dra ba de ni rang bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rtag pa rnams kyang gang gis so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed kyi thams cad ma yin pa de 'dra ba de ni rang bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: If you think, â€œIt is like this: permanent things also produce individually certain effects, but not all of them. That kind of certainty is their nature.

original: rang bzhin ni brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: It is not appropriate to dispute or investigate their nature,â€

original: 'o na de lta na gal te de'i rang bzhin 'di rang nyid kyis yin gyi gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin na de'i tshe brda 'dzin pa las snga rol du dang brda brjod pa'i so sor nges pa'i rtogs pa po de'i shes pa thams cad kyi tshe
analyzed: 'o na de lta na gal te de'i rang bzhin 'di rang nyid kyis yin gyi gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin na de'i tshe brda 'dzin pa las snga rol du dang brda brjod pa'i so sor nges pa'i rtogs pa po de'i shes pa thams cad kyi tshe
translated: But if the nature of that is itself, and it does not depend on another, then at the time of the cognition of the individual who apprehends the sign, prior to apprehending the sign,

original: 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: all cognitions would engage.

original: de'i shes pa skyed par byed pa la nges pa'i nus pa thams cad kyi tshe gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i shes pa skyed par byed pa la nges pa'i nus pa thams cad kyi tshe gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at the time of generating its cognition, all the certain potentials would remain.

original: yang ci ste shes par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi nus pa shes na shes pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi ma shes par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang ci ste shes par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi nus pa shes na shes pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi ma shes par ni ma yin no //
translated: But if it is said that the potential characterized by the connection is known because it is what causes knowledge, then it generates cognition, but not when it is not known.

original: des na ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: des na ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Therefore, if it is thought that the previously explained fault would ensue,

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: gal te shes pa dang mi shes pa'i gnas skabs gnyis phan tshun tha dad par 'dod na de'i tshe rtag pa nyams la ci ste tha mi dad na de'i tshe shes pa dang mi shes pa'i rang bzhin gnyis kyi rnam par dbye ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gal te shes pa dang mi shes pa'i gnas skabs gnyis phan tshun tha dad par 'dod na de'i tshe rtag pa nyams la ci ste tha mi dad na de'i tshe shes pa dang mi shes pa'i rang bzhin gnyis kyi rnam par dbye ba mi 'thad de /
translated: If you assert that the two statesâ€”of knowing and not knowingâ€”are mutually different, then at that time permanence is undermined. But if they are not different, then at that time it is untenable to distinguish the two natures of knowing and not knowing.

original: dngos po gcig skyes bu gcig la ltos nas shes pa dang ma shes pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis rigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gcig skyes bu gcig la ltos nas shes pa dang ma shes pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis rigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is illogical for a single thing to have two mutually contradictory natures in dependence on a single person, such as knowing and not knowing.

original: gzhan yang nus pa rtogs par byed pa'i thabs yod na shes pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang nus pa rtogs par byed pa'i thabs yod na shes pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if there were a means of understanding potential, it would be consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir de srid pa ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de srid pa ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that it is not possible,

original: 'dra ba ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: similarity is stated by â€œanotherâ€ and so on.ğŸ”½If you think that it is understood through the meaning,

original: gal te don gyis go bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas re zhig rgyas par gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te don gyis go bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas re zhig rgyas par gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: then this is the extensive anticipation of an objection.

original: 'di ltar gzhon nu ma len gyis 'brel ba rtogs pa'i thabs 'di smras te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhon nu ma len gyis 'brel ba rtogs pa'i thabs 'di smras te /
translated: Thus Kauá¹‡á¸abhiá¹‡á¸in states this method of understanding relations:

original: gang gi phyir re zhig dang por mngon sum gyi sgra dang 'brel ba chad par byed pa'i smra ba po dang brjod par bya ba ste brjod bya'i dngos po mthong la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir re zhig dang por mngon sum gyi sgra dang 'brel ba chad par byed pa'i smra ba po dang brjod par bya ba ste brjod bya'i dngos po mthong la /
translated: Because first of all, the speaker and the object of expression, i.e., the expressed entity, are seen to be related to the term â€œdirect perception.â€

original: de nas phyis g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid rtags kyis rjes su dpag pas nyan pa po rtogs pa nyid mthong ste /
analyzed: de nas phyis g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid rtags kyis rjes su dpag pas nyan pa po rtogs pa nyid mthong ste /
translated: Then, later, the hearer is seen to understand by inference through the reason having the nature of movement.

original: nges par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: â€œIs seenâ€ means â€œis ascertained.â€

original: byed pa ni byed pa pos byas pa'i g-yo bas rjes su dpag pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: byed pa ni byed pa pos byas pa'i g-yo bas rjes su dpag pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: â€œActionâ€ is said to be inferred by the movement produced by the agent.

original: de'i 'og tu don gyis go bas gnyis la brten pa'i nus pa rtogs te don gyis go bas dngos su mi rtogs pa de'i phyir don gyis go bas rtogs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu don gyis go bas gnyis la brten pa'i nus pa rtogs te don gyis go bas dngos su mi rtogs pa de'i phyir don gyis go bas rtogs so zhes bstan to //
translated: After that, the capacity based on the two is understood by implication. Since it is not directly understood by implication, it is taught that it is understood by implication.

original: tshad ma gsum pa zhes bya ba ni mngon @198a * //
analyzed: tshad ma gsum pa zhes bya ba ni mngon @198a * //
translated: â€œThe third valid cognitionâ€ is direct perception.

original: sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / don gyis go ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshad ma gsum gang zhig rtogs par bya ba'i don du yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / don gyis go ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshad ma gsum gang zhig rtogs par bya ba'i don du yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is called â€œthe three valid cognitionsâ€ is the three valid cognitions that are the means of understanding the object that is to be understood: direct perception, inference, and presumption.

original: gzhan du mi 'thad kho na'i phyir //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa 'chad de /
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'thad kho na'i phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa 'chad de /
translated: Because it is not tenable in any other way.ğŸ”½This is the explanation of the refutation.

original: 'dis ni don gyis go ba ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni don gyis go ba ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This shows that presumption is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: 'brel ba rtag pa med na yang rtogs pa srid par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba rtag pa med na yang rtogs pa srid par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has already been shown that it is possible to understand even when there is no permanent relation.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir rtag par mi rigs pa 'ga' zhig tu ma zad tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir yang mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir rtag par mi rigs pa 'ga' zhig tu ma zad tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir yang mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Not only is it not tenable because there is no valid means of knowledge that establishes it, it is also not tenable because it is undermined by valid knowledge. In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: nus pa rtag pa nyid phyogs la //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nus pa rtag pa nyid phyogs la // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The permanent potency is not tenable, etc.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag brda la ltos nas don gsal bar byed pa de dag ni 'brel ba rtag pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag brda la ltos nas don gsal bar byed pa de dag ni 'brel ba rtag pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: Those that make known the object in dependence on a sign do not have a permanent relation.

original: dper na ga ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ga ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the words â€œcowâ€ and so on.

original: 'jig rten pa dang rig byed kyi goo la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyang brda la ltos nas don gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang rig byed kyi goo la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyang brda la ltos nas don gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa ste /
translated: The words of the world and the Vedas, etc., also make known their meanings in dependence on conventions. This is the observation of a pervasion by contradiction,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid la ni 'brel ba rtag pa dang ldan pa nyid dang 'gal ba mi rtag pa'i 'brel ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid la ni 'brel ba rtag pa dang ldan pa nyid dang 'gal ba mi rtag pa'i 'brel ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which depends on something else is pervaded by the possession of a permanent relation, and that which is not pervaded by the possession of a permanent relation is pervaded by the possession of an impermanent relation.

original: tshad ma 'di yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma 'di yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This means of valid cognition will be explained.

original: 'dir ni de'i khyab pa tsam zhig sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni de'i khyab pa tsam zhig sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: Here, we are proving merely the pervasion of that.

original: 'di ltar sgra rnams ni don rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pas 'brel pa rtag pa dang ldan par 'dod la nus pa de yang rtag pa'i phyir phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pas brda la sogs pas 'ga' zhig la yang ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra rnams ni don rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pas 'brel pa rtag pa dang ldan par 'dod la nus pa de yang rtag pa'i phyir phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pas brda la sogs pas 'ga' zhig la yang ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, words are accepted as having a permanent relation by means of a relation characterized by the understanding of the meaning, and that capacity is permanent. Therefore, since it is not something to be benefited, it does not depend on anything, such as a convention.

original: de lta yin dang de las byung ba'i sgra'i don rtogs pa thams cad kyi tshe 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang de las byung ba'i sgra'i don rtogs pa thams cad kyi tshe 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then all the time that the meaning of the word arises, it would be transformed.

original: gzhan yang nus pa de don gcig la nges pa yin nam don du ma la nges pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang nus pa de don gcig la nges pa yin nam don du ma la nges pa yin /
translated: Moreover, is that potency ascertained in regard to one object or is it ascertained in regard to many objects?

original: don du ma la nges pa'i phyogs de la yang ci sgra 'di'i nges pa don du ma gsal bar byed pa gcig nyid yin nam /
analyzed: don du ma la nges pa'i phyogs de la yang ci sgra 'di'i nges pa don du ma gsal bar byed pa gcig nyid yin nam /
translated: In the case of the latter, is it that the ascertainment of the meaning of this word is done by one who makes the many objects manifest,

original: 'on te du ma yin zhes rnam par brtag go //
analyzed: 'on te du ma yin zhes rnam par brtag go //
translated: or is it done by many?

original: de la phyogs dang po la yul dang dus la sogs pa tha dad pas brda gzhan byed pa na sgra don gzhan rtogs par byed pa gang yin pa 'di mthong ste /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la yul dang dus la sogs pa tha dad pas brda gzhan byed pa na sgra don gzhan rtogs par byed pa gang yin pa 'di mthong ste /
translated: In the first case, when a different convention is made in regard to a different place, time, and so on, one sees that the meaning of the word is understood to be different.

original: dper na ka li dang ma ri la sogs pa'i sgra rnams 'gro lding ba dang 'phags pa'i yul pa dag la go rims bzhin du dus kyi cha dang char 'bab pa dang nye bar 'tshe ba la sogs pa rjod par byed pa can gyi sgra las don gzhan
analyzed: dper na ka li dang ma ri la sogs pa'i sgra rnams 'gro lding ba dang 'phags pa'i yul pa dag la go rims bzhin du dus kyi cha dang char 'bab pa dang nye bar 'tshe ba la sogs pa rjod par byed pa can gyi sgra las don gzhan
translated: For example, in the case of the words kali and mari, the Dravidians and the Aryans, respectively, understand them to mean â€œtimeâ€ and â€œrain.â€

original: rtogs par byed pa @198b nyid du mthong ba gang yin pa der 'byung ba ste nus pa nges pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa @198b nyid du mthong ba gang yin pa der 'byung ba ste nus pa nges pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: That which is seen as the cause of understanding is the cause of the understanding of the meaning, because the capacity is ascertained, like the eye, etc.

original: mig ni brda'i dbang gis ro la sogs pa'i don du sbyor bar 'ongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig ni brda'i dbang gis ro la sogs pa'i don du sbyor bar 'ongs pa ma yin no //
translated: The eye is not applied to the meaning of taste, etc. by the power of convention.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang sgra gcig las cig car skyes bu thams cad la don thams cad rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang sgra gcig las cig car skyes bu thams cad la don thams cad rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the second case, too, it follows that all meanings are understood by all persons simultaneously from one sound.

original: de nyid ston pa ni /ğŸ”½gal te sna tshogs don gsal phyir //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni / gal te sna tshogs don gsal phyir //
translated: To show just that, he says:ğŸ”½If it is because of the manifestation of various meanings,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: etc.

original: 'di nyid la skyon gzhan 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid la skyon gzhan 'chad pa ni /
translated: Here he explains another fault:

original: don ni gsal bar byed nus pa //
analyzed: don ni gsal bar byed nus pa //
translated: If it is able to manifest the meaning,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: etc.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni nus pa don rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni nus pa don rtogs pa yin no //
translated: There, the capacity is the understanding of the meaning.

original: mi g-yo zhes bya ba ni rtag pa ste 'di yang phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa nyid la gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: mi g-yo zhes bya ba ni rtag pa ste 'di yang phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa nyid la gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Unmoving means permanent. This is also the reason for not being able to benefit.

original: brda la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid khas blangs nas kyang nyes pa gzhan 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: brda la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid khas blangs nas kyang nyes pa gzhan 'chad pa ni /
translated: Another fault is stated, having accepted that it is dependent on convention:

original: don ni gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: don ni gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu //
translated: The cause of the clarification of meaning

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.ğŸ”½The meaning is that it is understood without confusion.

original: don ma 'chol bar shes pa yin no snyam pas khyed kyi 'chol ba'i rgyu skyes bu bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: don ma 'chol bar shes pa yin no snyam pas khyed kyi 'chol ba'i rgyu skyes bu bkag pa yin te /
translated: The cause of confusion, the person, is refuted by you,

original: de la ji ltar la lar de dag gi don thams cad thun mong ba'i sgra rnams bsre bar byed pa de bzhin du rigs byed thams cad kyang la lar de dag gi 'dod pa'i dbang gis brda byas pa na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar la lar de dag gi don thams cad thun mong ba'i sgra rnams bsre bar byed pa de bzhin du rigs byed thams cad kyang la lar de dag gi 'dod pa'i dbang gis brda byas pa na /
translated: because just as in some cases all the meanings of those words that are common to all are mixed, in the same way, in some cases, due to the power of desire, all the poetic meters are also conventionally designated.

original: ci'i phyir 'chol bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'chol bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Why would they not be confused?

original: skyes bu de dag ni de kho na nyid yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu de dag ni de kho na nyid yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those persons do not fully understand reality.

original: 'di ltar brda ni 'dod pa'i dbang gis yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar brda ni 'dod pa'i dbang gis yin la /
translated: In this way, convention is due to the power of desire.

original: de yang de kho na nyid mi shes pa de dag rang dbang du 'jug pa na gang zhig nges par 'gyur /
analyzed: de yang de kho na nyid mi shes pa de dag rang dbang du 'jug pa na gang zhig nges par 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, when those who do not understand reality engage independently, what is certain?

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa las 'byung ba'i rang dbang gis brda yang rang dbang can gyi 'grus pa gzhan du ci'i phyir 'gal ba'i don spong bar byed nus pa don du ma gsal bar byed pa'i phyogs khas blangs nas skyon gzhan 'chad pa ni /

analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni slar la legs par sbyar ba'i sgra nyid kyis don ston par byed pa na mgo rmongs par 'gyur te /
