original: de lta bas na rtsa ba'i sgra'i rjes su 'brangs nas don rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //ğŸ”½yang na yul 'jig pa dang rigs chad pa'i ngo bo'i 'jig par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: de lta bas na rtsa ba'i sgra'i rjes su 'brangs nas don rtogs par byed pa ma yin no // yang na yul 'jig pa dang rigs chad pa'i ngo bo'i 'jig par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: Therefore, they do not understand the meaning by following the root text.ğŸ”½Or, the meaning of the passage, â€œThe object is destroyed, and the lineage is cut off,â€ etc., is as follows.

original: yul 'jig pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yul 'jig pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œThe object is destroyed, etc.â€

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The following thought occurs to him.

original: kho bo cag gis thams cad rgyun chad pa'i bdag nyid 'jig pa yin par ma @200b brjod la 'byin pa dang sdud pa'i bdag nyid kyi thog ma med pa'i skyes bu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis thams cad rgyun chad pa'i bdag nyid 'jig pa yin par ma @200b brjod la 'byin pa dang sdud pa'i bdag nyid kyi thog ma med pa'i skyes bu yang ma yin no //
translated: We do not say that everything has the nature of being destroyed, nor do we say that the beginningless person has the nature of emitting and reabsorbing.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do we say?

original: 'gro ba thams cad thog ma med pa'i tha snyad dang ldan te thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i mthar thug pa'i sgra las byung ba 'jug pa yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad thog ma med pa'i tha snyad dang ldan te thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i mthar thug pa'i sgra las byung ba 'jug pa yin no snyam mo //
translated: We think that all beings have beginningless conventions, and that they engage in terms that are the culmination of thoughts that arise from beginningless latent propensities.

original: 'on kyang khyed cag ni yul 'jig pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'jig par brjod la /
analyzed: 'on kyang khyed cag ni yul 'jig pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'jig par brjod la /
translated: However, you say that the nature of the destruction of an object is destruction.

original: gang yang sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis me dang chu dang rlung dag gis 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa'i bar dang 'og gi mtshams ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang / steng du go rims bzhin du bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i mthar thug pa 'di tshad mas mi gnod pa'i phyir gnod pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: gang yang sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis me dang chu dang rlung dag gis 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa'i bar dang 'og gi mtshams ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang / steng du go rims bzhin du bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i mthar thug pa 'di tshad mas mi gnod pa'i phyir gnod pa med pa yin la /
translated: Also, Buddhists do not refute the wind mandala that extends to the edge of the trichiliocosm, which is empty of the nature of destruction by fire, water and wind, and the wind mandala that extends to the edge of the first, second and third absorptions above and the edge of the desire realm below.

original: dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir tshangs pa la sogs pa la yang dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir tshangs pa la sogs pa la yang dogs pa yin no //
translated: They also do not refute Brahma and so on, because they cannot be refuted.

original: 'jig pa de gnyis ka la yang rig byed 'jig par srid de /
analyzed: 'jig pa de gnyis ka la yang rig byed 'jig par srid de /
translated: In both of those destructions, it is possible that the Vedas are destroyed.

original: phyin ci log gi don rtogs pa na yang rig byed 'di gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi don rtogs pa na yang rig byed 'di gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: Even when the meaning of the Vedas is understood incorrectly, the Vedas are still the Vedas.

original: 'dra ba nyid de snang 'gyur ba //
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid de snang 'gyur ba //
translated: They appear to be similar.

original: zhes bya ba ni khyed kyis ji srid du gnod pa can gyi tshad ma brjod pa de srid du dogs pa ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyed kyis ji srid du gnod pa can gyi tshad ma brjod pa de srid du dogs pa ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as you do not state a valid cognition that contradicts the Vedas, you cannot stop the doubt that the Vedas are false.

original: 'di snyam du gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'di yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'di yod pa kho na ste /
translated: One might think as follows: This is a valid reason for refuting you,

original: 'di ltar re zhig da ltar yul thams cad du skyes bu rnams kyis rig byed 'don pa la sogs pa gzhan du bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig da ltar yul thams cad du skyes bu rnams kyis rig byed 'don pa la sogs pa gzhan du bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: because for the time being, in all places, people are not able to perform other actions, such as reciting the Vedas,

original: de'i phyir dus gzhan du yang de ltar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus gzhan du yang de ltar 'byung ngo //
translated: and therefore they will occur in the same way at other times as well.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes nges pas de'i phyir dogs pa 'di bsu nas rnam pa gzhan du byed 'dod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes nges pas de'i phyir dogs pa 'di bsu nas rnam pa gzhan du byed 'dod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to anticipate this qualm, he says, â€œEven if one wishes to act in a different way,â€ and so on.

original: gal te gzhan du byed par 'dod pa na rig byed kyi sgra gzhan du 'jug pa par mi 'gyur ba dang gzhan du byed par 'dod pa yang skyed par mi nus pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan du byed par 'dod pa na rig byed kyi sgra gzhan du 'jug pa par mi 'gyur ba dang gzhan du byed par 'dod pa yang skyed par mi nus pa yin na /
translated: If one wishes to act in a different way, the sound of the Vedas will not be uttered in a different way, and one will not be able to produce the desire to act in a different way.

original: de'i tshe skyes bu rnams kyi rig byed 'dod pa la sogs pa gzhan du bya bar mi nus par grub par 'gyur na de la yang skyes bu thams cad kyi mi 'grub ste ma mthong ba tsam tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir dang / skyes bu dag kyang khyad par du 'phags par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe skyes bu rnams kyi rig byed 'dod pa la sogs pa gzhan du bya bar mi nus par grub par 'gyur na de la yang skyes bu thams cad kyi mi 'grub ste ma mthong ba tsam tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir dang / skyes bu dag kyang khyad par du 'phags par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, it would be established that the Vedas of people cannot be used for other purposes, such as desire, but that also is not established for all people, because mere non-seeing is not a valid cognition and because people appear to be superior.

original: gang gi phyir bdag cag la ltas legs par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rig byed kyi ngag 'don pa gzhan du yang bya bar nus shing don yang bshad par nus pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag cag la ltas legs par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rig byed kyi ngag 'don pa gzhan du yang bya bar nus shing don yang bshad par nus pa ste /
translated: Because we can use the Vedic recitations, such as â€œMay we do good deeds,â€ for other purposes and we can explain their meaning.

original: 'di ltar spyod pa pa dang nges tshig la sogs pas rig byed kyi don rnam pa mang po byed par mthong @201a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar spyod pa pa dang nges tshig la sogs pas rig byed kyi don rnam pa mang po byed par mthong @201a * //
translated: Thus we see that the meaning of the Vedas is used in many ways, such as in the conduct of life and in etymologies.

original: ste ; de lta bas na dogs pa ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ste ; de lta bas na dogs pa ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the doubt is not eliminated.

original: rig pa 'bras bu nyid min te //
analyzed: rig pa 'bras bu nyid min te //
translated: The Vedas are not the resultğŸ”½and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan brjod pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan brjod pa de la /
translated: The response to that is:

original: de phyir skyes bu thams cad kyis //
analyzed: de phyir skyes bu thams cad kyis //
translated: Therefore all people

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is what is meant by the above passage.

original: tshig rnams dang ngag rnams dang yi ge rnams yin pas de skad du brjod la de dag gi rim pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshig rnams dang ngag rnams dang yi ge rnams yin pas de skad du brjod la de dag gi rim pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The words, speech, and letters are called â€œthatâ€ and their order is to be connected with the words.

original: don med pa yi gzhung tsam la //
analyzed: don med pa yi gzhung tsam la //
translated: The mere text that has no meaning

original: zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi byas pa nyams zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi byas pa nyams zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: is to be connected with â€œyour composition is flawed.â€

original: gzhung 'ga' zhig la don yod pa ma yin pa 'di ni se'u bcu la sogs pa'i ngag bzhin du don med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhung 'ga' zhig la don yod pa ma yin pa 'di ni se'u bcu la sogs pa'i ngag bzhin du don med pa'o //
translated: Some texts have no meaning, like the speech of a ten-year-old child.

original: yang na sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las rig byed dang 'gal ba'i don med pa'o //ğŸ”½'di ni don med pa yang ma yin la gzhung tsam yang yin pas de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las rig byed dang 'gal ba'i don med pa'o // 'di ni don med pa yang ma yin la gzhung tsam yang yin pas de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Or, the meaning of the Buddhist philosophical systems and so on is not contradicted by the Vedas.ğŸ”½This is called â€œthe mere text that has no meaning.â€

original: tsam gyi sgras ni khyab pa ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tsam gyi sgras ni khyab pa ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word â€œmereâ€ shows that it is not the case that it has no meaning.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rig byed ltar ro byas zhes bya ba ni byed pa la'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rig byed ltar ro byas zhes bya ba ni byed pa la'o //
translated: â€œThusâ€ means like the Vedas. â€œIs flawedâ€ is in the sense of an action.

original: 'di ni nges pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni nges pa med cing nges pa der mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni nges pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni nges pa med cing nges pa der mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is not definite means that it is not definite, that it does not become definite.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means for that reason.

original: ji ltar 'di gzhan gyis brjod pa //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di gzhan gyis brjod pa //
translated: As it was said, how is this expressed by another?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: gzhan gyi brjod pa dag gis brjod //ğŸ”½ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /ğŸ”½las kyi bye brag ji bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi brjod pa dag gis brjod // ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te / las kyi bye brag ji bzhin no //
translated: It is expressed by the expressions of others.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the seventh case is just as the distinction of action.

original: 'dis ni gcig tu gtogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la srid par bstan pas ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gcig tu gtogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la srid par bstan pas ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that it is indefinite because it is possible to attribute it to the opposite.

original: gal te 'di snyam du 'khrul ba nyid du ji ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du 'khrul ba nyid du ji ltar grub ce na /
translated: If one thinks, how is it established as just error?

original: dbyangs la sogs dang mi 'dra'i phyir //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dbyangs la sogs dang mi 'dra'i phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because it is unlike melody, etc.

original: dbyangs la sogs zhes bya ba ni ring po la sogs pa'i sgras myur ba dang dal ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: dbyangs la sogs zhes bya ba ni ring po la sogs pa'i sgras myur ba dang dal ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: Melody, etc. refers to the sounds of long, etc., which are taken as fast, slow, etc.

original: 'di ni gsal byed chos ma yin //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba ni dbyangs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsal byed chos ma yin // zhes bya ba ni dbyangs la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is not the case with the phonemes.

original: gang las she na dbyangs la sogs pa de ni yi ge'i bdag nyid du mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang las she na dbyangs la sogs pa de ni yi ge'i bdag nyid du mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: The phonemes, etc. are not the nature of the letters, because they are seen as the nature of sound.

original: grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are not established as the nature of the letters.

original: de'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni yi ge tha dad pa de'i mtshan ma ni de'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: de'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni yi ge tha dad pa de'i mtshan ma ni de'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: The sign of that is the sign of the different letters.

original: mtshan ma gzhan ni khyed la med //
analyzed: mtshan ma gzhan ni khyed la med //
translated: You have no other sign.ğŸ”½Why do you deny that?ğŸ”½Thus, the pot, etc.

original: ces bya ba 'dis de ci'i phyir 'gegs pa smros shig / de ltar bum pa la sogs kyi //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /ğŸ”½rigs kyis bum pa la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis de ci'i phyir 'gegs pa smros shig / de ltar bum pa la sogs kyi // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / rigs kyis bum pa la sogs pa'i //
translated: The pot, etc. are by the universal.ğŸ”½The universal is not the pot, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The universal is not the pot, etc.

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni @201b spyi brtag par ro //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni @201b spyi brtag par ro //
translated: Previously, in the Examination of the Universal.

original: don med pas na zhes bya ba ni rigs te mi bden pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: don med pas na zhes bya ba ni rigs te mi bden pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Because it is meaningless, i.e., because it is not true.

original: yod pa yin yang phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa'i rigs de bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsal ba dang 'brel pa mi rung ba'i phyir des tha snyad nye bar mtshon pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa yin yang phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa'i rigs de bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsal ba dang 'brel pa mi rung ba'i phyir des tha snyad nye bar mtshon pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if it did exist, it would be improper for that which is not a benefit to be related to the manifestation of the definition of a pot, etc. Therefore, it is improper for it to be indicated by the convention.ğŸ”½Thus, all of this that is imputed by way of the universal is without relation.

original: des na rigs kyi sgo nas nye bar btags pa gang yin pa 'di thams cad 'brel ba med pa yin no zhes stan pa ni /
analyzed: des na rigs kyi sgo nas nye bar btags pa gang yin pa 'di thams cad 'brel ba med pa yin no zhes stan pa ni /
translated: To teach this, he says,

original: de phyir rkan la sogs pa'i rigs //
analyzed: de phyir rkan la sogs pa'i rigs //
translated: Therefore, the universal of palate, etc.ğŸ”½and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That which was said,

original: de dag gi sgra mngon gsal rgyu //
analyzed: de dag gi sgra mngon gsal rgyu //
translated: The universal is the cause of the manifestation of the sound,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: and so on,

original: rigs khas blangs nas sun 'byin pa 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: rigs khas blangs nas sun 'byin pa 'chad pa ni /
translated: is explained as a refutation that accepts the universal.

original: gzhan yang sgra yi mngon gsal rgyu //
analyzed: gzhan yang sgra yi mngon gsal rgyu //
translated: Moreover, the universal is the cause of the manifestation of the sound,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: tshig phrad kyi tshogs 'di yang dag nye bar bkod pa la blta bar bya'o //ğŸ”½de ltar zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: tshig phrad kyi tshogs 'di yang dag nye bar bkod pa la blta bar bya'o // de ltar zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: This collection of words and particles should be seen as being properly arranged.ğŸ”½Thus means cause.

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning.

original: gang gi phyir rigs tha dad pa rnams ni sgra mngon par gsal ba'i rgyur gnas te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rigs tha dad pa rnams ni sgra mngon par gsal ba'i rgyur gnas te /
translated: Because the different types exist as the cause of the manifestation of sound.

original: des na gsal bar byed pa rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir sgra yang rtag tu dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gsal bar byed pa rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir sgra yang rtag tu dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because the manifester always exists, sound would always be perceived.

original: de lta yin dang gsal ba'i rim pa med pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyi sgra'i rim pa yang rigs pa ma yin no /
analyzed: de lta yin dang gsal ba'i rim pa med pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyi sgra'i rim pa yang rigs pa ma yin no /
translated: If that were the case, because there would be no sequence of manifestation, it would be illogical for there to be a sequence of sound that is of the same nature.

original: de dang ldan pa'i gsal ba zhes gang smras pa de la rigs dang gsal ba dang 'brel pa khas blangs nas skyon 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i gsal ba zhes gang smras pa de la rigs dang gsal ba dang 'brel pa khas blangs nas skyon 'chad pa ni /
translated: As for what was said about â€œmanifestation that possesses that,â€ the error is explained by accepting the connection between the type and manifestation:

original: gsal ba dang 'brel ngo bo yi //
analyzed: gsal ba dang 'brel ngo bo yi //
translated: The nature connected to manifestation

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: 'brel ba ni gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir dang / rigs rnams kyang rtag pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel ba ni gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir dang / rigs rnams kyang rtag pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the connection exists in two things, and because the types are accepted as permanent,

original: de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gsal ba rnams kyang rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gsal ba rnams kyang rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: the nature connected to them, the manifestations, would also be permanent.

original: de lta ma yin na rigs rnams de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin nyid du mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rigs rnams de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin nyid du mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: If it were not so, the universals would not be the nature of that which is related to them.

original: / de bzhin du gsal ba rnams mi rtag par khas blangs pa'i phyir de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gyi rigs kyang mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½gal te de dang 'brel ba'i rigs rnams kyang mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur na de lta na de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gyi gsal ba rnams mi rtag pa nyid du grub par 'gyur gyi gzhan du na 'brel ba gnyis pa ma tshang ba med pa yin
analyzed: / de bzhin du gsal ba rnams mi rtag par khas blangs pa'i phyir de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gyi rigs kyang mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro // gal te de dang 'brel ba'i rigs rnams kyang mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur na de lta na de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gyi gsal ba rnams mi rtag pa nyid du grub par 'gyur gyi gzhan du na 'brel ba gnyis pa ma tshang ba med pa yin
translated: In the same way, since the manifestations are accepted as impermanent, the universals which are their nature and are related to them are also impermanent.

original: pa na gzhan ma tshang bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa na gzhan ma tshang bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If the universals which are related to them are impermanent, then the manifestations which are their nature and are related to them are established as impermanent. Otherwise, if the second relation is not complete, it is not reasonable that the first should be complete.

original: de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, it would follow that the nature of that which is related to them would be impaired.

original: skyon gzhan sngar bshad pa dran par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skyon gzhan sngar bshad pa dran par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to recall another fault, he says,

original: mngon par gsal ba mi 'thad par //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa @202a * //
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba mi 'thad par //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa @202a * //
translated: The manifestation is not tenable.

original: smos te / dus kyi zhes bya ba ni drug pa'i mtha' can no //
analyzed: smos te / dus kyi zhes bya ba ni drug pa'i mtha' can no //
translated: The word â€œalsoâ€ is to be supplied.ğŸ”½Time is one, pervasive, and eternal,ğŸ”½and so on.ğŸ”½Time also is not the illuminator of anything, because it is not an illuminator.

original: dus kyang gcig dang khyab pa dang rtag / ces bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la dus kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te dang po nyid du zhes bya ba ni /

translated: This appearance

original: / gzhan gyi chos kyang gtan tshigs ma yin te /
analyzed: / gzhan gyi chos kyang gtan tshigs ma yin te /

analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ches kyang gtan tshigs ma yin te /

then that is

analyzed: gzhan te de'i khongs su gtogs pa'i gcig po 'ga' zhig yang nas yang du bzlas pas ci'i phyir gsal bar mi byed /

original: des byas pa na gsal bar ma byas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des byas pa na gsal bar ma byas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you do that, it is not the case that it is not stated.

original: 'di ltar thams cad kyi tshad ma gcig yin pa'i phyir de'i gsal ba bzlas tsam gyis yi ge phyi ma phyi ma brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad kyi tshad ma gcig yin pa'i phyir de'i gsal ba bzlas tsam gyis yi ge phyi ma phyi ma brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because all the words are one sentence, by merely repeating the statement of that, the later letters are stated.

original: bzlas pa de bas gcig nyid kyis yang nas yang du bzlas par bya bar nus pa'i phyir yi ge lhag ma brjod pa don med do //
analyzed: bzlas pa de bas gcig nyid kyis yang nas yang du bzlas par bya bar nus pa'i phyir yi ge lhag ma brjod pa don med do //

original: yi ge phyi ma phyi ma yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yi ge phyi ma phyi ma yang ma yin te /
translated: The later letters are not stated.

original: nus pa tha dad pa nyid du khas blangs nas cha shas med pa'i khyad par gzhan brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / khyad par gzhan gyi rgyu med pas nus pa tha dad pa brtags pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

original: min nam zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: min nam zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: â€œ Is it not?â€ is a question.

original: yul dang dbang po legs byas pa'i //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po legs byas pa'i //
translated: The object and sense faculty are well-formed,

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / yi ge bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yi ge dag la rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba dang mi rung ba'i rang bzhin brtags pas yul dang dbang po legs par byas pa'i ngo bo'i mngon par gsal bas sun dbyung ba de bzhin du 'dir yang
translated: and so on.ğŸ”½â€œ Just like the lettersâ€ means that just as the letters are criticized by the analysis of the nature of the production and non-production of consciousness, in the same way, here too,

analyzed: sun dbyung bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de snang ba'i zhes bya ba ni gsal bar snang ba la yang ste khas blangs @205b nas rtsod pa 'di yin no //

original: 'di skad du bstan pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa 'di yin te /

analyzed: de las 'di'i mngon par gsal ba srid par 'gyur te /

translated: consciousness alone would arise in that way.ğŸ”½But since the endurance of the past does not exist, it is illogical that it would appear.

analyzed: gang gi phyir 'das pa gnas pa med pa nyid kyi phyir de snang bar mi rigs so zhes ston pa ni /

translated: The word â€œcowâ€ and so on is stated.ğŸ”½This is a single cognition, and its entity is that itself.

analyzed: de dag gi dngos po ni de 'dzin don gcig nyid de dag gis gcig tu brjod do //

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching.

original: blo gcig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir dang ; lkog shal la sogs pa'i don gcig gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ba lang gi sgra gcig tu brjod pa yin no //

original: de zhes bya ba ni blo gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni blo gcig pa'o //
translated: â€œ Thatâ€ refers to the singleness of cognition.

original: myur phyir ni mgyogs par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myur phyir ni mgyogs par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œ Because of speedâ€ means because of the rapid utterance.

translated: â€œ Interruptionâ€ means the extreme separation of the syllables.

original: lhas byin la sogs pa'i tshig ni yi ge so so la dbyangs dang bcas pa rnam par chad pas gsal bar tha dad du gtogs pa yin pa'i phyir blo gcig pa nyid phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub po //
analyzed: lhas byin la sogs pa'i tshig ni yi ge so so la dbyangs dang bcas pa rnam par chad pas gsal bar tha dad du gtogs pa yin pa'i phyir blo gcig pa nyid phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub po //
translated: The words of Devadatta, etc., are clearly divided by the individual syllables, with their vowels and consonants, so the singleness of cognition is not established in one part of the direction.

original: don gyi blo 'di yi ges bslangs //
analyzed: don gyi blo 'di yi ges bslangs //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyor bar byed de /

original: blo gang zhig rnam par shes pa gang gi mjug thogs su 'byung ba de ni rgyud nas de ni kun nas bslang ba yin te /

translated: The mind that arises immediately after a consciousness is aroused by that consciousness.

translated: In order to avoid the fallacy of nonestablishment in this case,ğŸ”½he says,ğŸ”½The mind that has the meaning arises from the letters,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /

original: de yang gang zhe na /

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'di ni rtag pa yin la rang spyi'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rtag pa'i don dang 'brel pas /
translated: The object of refutation is not qualified.ğŸ”½Any conceptual thought that qualifies itğŸ”½Is a reductio.

original: de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is called â€œpermanentâ€ because it is related to the meaning of â€œpermanentâ€ as a characteristic of a universal or particular.

original: des bskyed pa'i blo gang yin pa de gal te phyogs yin na /
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i blo gang yin pa de gal te phyogs yin na /
translated: If the cognition produced by that is a subject,

analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan sangs rgyas pa la ma grub pa yin no //
translated: then it is not established for the other party, the Buddhist.ğŸ”½If one says that â€œutter non-existence is what is meant by impermanence,â€

original: gal te gtan nas 'jig pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid du brjod pa na zhes gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: gal te gtan nas 'jig pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid du brjod pa na zhes gang smras pa de la /

analyzed: gzhan du na gang zhig gang dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa yin pa de ji ltar de'i rang bzhin du rigs snyam du bsams pa yin no // dbang pos gzung ba nyid 'ba' zhig / ces bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la / dbang po 'ba' zhig gis gzung nyid //
translated: Otherwise, how could it be tenable that that which is established and exists as one with something is the nature of the latter?ğŸ”½With regard to what was said, â€œIt is apprehended only by the sense faculties,â€

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

translated: it is said, â€œIt is not apprehended only by the sense faculties.â€

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni spyi brtag par ro //ğŸ”½gal @208a * //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni spyi brtag par ro // gal @208a * //
translated: â€œPreviouslyâ€ refers to the Examination of the Universal.

original: te rigs kyi 'khrul pa ma yin pa de lta na yang ldog pa la the tshom za ba yang ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes dogs pa la /ğŸ”½dbang pos gzung bar bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi 'brel ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: rang snang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the connection of the reason that it is apprehended by the sense faculties, it is said, â€œIt is not the case that it is not apprehended by the sense faculties,â€ and so on.ğŸ”½â€œIt is not the case that it is not apprehended by the sense facultiesâ€ and so on.

analyzed: rang snang ba'i dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyu'i don ni dbang po'i gzung bar bya ba brjod do //
translated: The meaning of the cause of the sense consciousness that perceives itself is the object that is grasped by the sense faculty.

original: dbang pos gzung bya nyid sogs na //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: 'di 'dra'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: de lta ma yin na du ba la sogs pa la yang rnam par rtogs par bya bar nus te /

original: ci rdzas brgyad kyi du ba rtags nyid du len tam /
analyzed: ci rdzas brgyad kyi du ba rtags nyid du len tam /

original: gzhan yang yan lag can nam /

analyzed: kun rdzob tu 'bras bu 'ga' zhig rtsom par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical to posit any result conventionally,

analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would then follow that its characteristics would be lost.

original: gang zhig don gyi bya ba byed pa gang yin pa de nyid don dam pa yin la gzhan ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu yod pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //

translated: That which performs the function of an object is ultimate, and that which is other than that exists conventionally. This is the definition of ultimate and conventional existence.

original: ci ste bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi lugs kyi 'khrul pa de yang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa la sogs pa khyed cag gis 'dzin @208b pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ci 'dra ba brjod pa gang yin pa de 'dra ba ni bye brag tu smrağŸ”½ba rnams kyis mi 'dod do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: ci ste bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi lugs kyi 'khrul pa de yang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa la sogs pa khyed cag gis 'dzin @208b pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ci 'dra ba brjod pa gang yin pa de 'dra ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis mi 'dod do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: If the VaibhÄá¹£ika system is mistaken, then what is the nature of analytical cessations and so on that you SautrÄntikas assert?

original: 'gog pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'gog pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: 'gog pa dag ces bya ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa gnyis so ;

original: / de dag ci 'dra ba zhe na /
analyzed: / de dag ci 'dra ba zhe na /

original: gang phyir zag pa bcas kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po rnams dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po rnams dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pa ste /

analyzed: shes rab kyis thod pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya la /

analyzed: de yang ldan pa'i rdzas re re la tha dad pa yin no //

analyzed: ldan pa'i rdzas ji snyed pa bral ba'i rdzas rnams kyang de snyed do zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de yang so sor brtags pas thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang so sor brtags pas thob pa ni ma yin no //

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /

analyzed: rkyen ma tshang ba ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa zhes bya ba ste /

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa gang //

analyzed: bral ba'o so so so so yin //

analyzed: skye la gtan du gegs byed pa //

translated: is another cessation, not attained by analysis.ğŸ”½It is not a mistake to say that it is the nature of destruction.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /ğŸ”½brtsal ma thag tu byung min //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / brtsal ma thag tu byung min //

original: gang las she na /

analyzed: gyo mo snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse text says, â€œThe appearance of a pot, etc.

translated: â€ The collection of appearances is the assembly of appearances.

analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'od la sogs pa'i tshogs bzung ngo // khyed med @209a * //

analyzed: rtag min mi rtag min //

analyzed: gal te de dag 'gro na de dag nye ba na gnas pa'i rtsva dang ras bal la sogs pa ci'i phyir sred par mi byed ce na / des na 'di dag 'gro na yang //

analyzed: ngag ni rtag pa nyid brjod bya //

translated: then NÄgÄrjuna says, â€œHow could speech be speech?â€ and so on in order to analyze speech.

analyzed: res 'ga' khyad par med pa'i yi ge tsam nyid ngag tu 'gyur ram /

analyzed: gsal ba'i rim pa'ang ngag min no // zhes bya ba la @210a * //

analyzed: de ni dpyod pa rnams kyis bsal zin pa'i phyir snyam du bsam pa yin no // rtag pa'i gsal ba bkag phyir ro //

translated: Because the purpose of seeing is conventionally designated.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /ğŸ”½ji ltar spel la sogs pa smra //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la / ji ltar spel la sogs pa smra //
translated: With regard to what was said,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: how can you speak of multiplication, etc.?

original: 'dod pas bkod pa'i don gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas bkod pa'i don gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the meaning of what is arranged by desire is so called.

original: skyes bus 'phral byas pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bus 'phral byas pa ste /
translated: That which is created by a person is so called.

original: sngar na med par rang shes kyis byas pa bu mo dkar mo chen mo la sogs pa'i gtam rgyud gang yin pa de nyid kyi ngo bo ste rang bzhin zlos gar dang sgrung rgyud la sogs pa gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o
analyzed: sngar na med par rang shes kyis byas pa bu mo dkar mo chen mo la sogs pa'i gtam rgyud gang yin pa de nyid kyi ngo bo ste rang bzhin zlos gar dang sgrung rgyud la sogs pa gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o
translated: That which is created by oneâ€™s own consciousness without having existed before is the nature, the essence, of those things that are the stories of MahÄpÄá¹‡á¸arÄ, etc. Those things that are dramas, narratives, etc. are so called.

original: // de dag la sgra dang don zhes bya ba'i nus pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi brjod par 'dod pa'i 'brel pa brtag pa yod pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du rig byed la yang srid pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: // de dag la sgra dang don zhes bya ba'i nus pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi brjod par 'dod pa'i 'brel pa brtag pa yod pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du rig byed la yang srid pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: and they do not have the connection of the relationship of the expressed and the expresser, which is characterized by the capacity called â€œwordâ€ and â€œmeaning,â€ just so, it is possible that the Veda also is like that.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lugs kyis dpe ma grub pa nyid du dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lugs kyis dpe ma grub pa nyid du dogs pa yin te /
translated: In response to that, he says, â€œIn that case, etc.,â€ and he suspects that the example is not established by the opponentâ€™s system.

original: 'phral la byas pa'i gtam rgyud la sogs pa de la yang nus pa rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'phral la byas pa'i gtam rgyud la sogs pa de la yang nus pa rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: In that case, even in the story, etc., that is made up on the spot, the capacity is asserted to be permanent.

original: 'on kyang med pa'i don la nges par sbyor ba skyes bus byas pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang med pa'i don la nges par sbyor ba skyes bus byas pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtag ste /
translated: However, the application of the meaning of nonexistence is produced by a person, and that is impermanent.

original: de'i dbang gis nus pa la mi rtag pa nyid rtogs pa'i 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis nus pa la mi rtag pa nyid rtogs pa'i 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: By its power, there is the error of understanding the impermanence of the capacity.

original: de lta bas na dpe ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na dpe ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the example is not established.

original: de la phyi rol zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de la phyi rol zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: In response to that, he says, â€œThe external, etc.,â€ and he replies.

original: phyi rol zhes bya ba ni bu mo dkar mo chen mo la sogs pa'i don no //
analyzed: phyi rol zhes bya ba ni bu mo dkar mo chen mo la sogs pa'i don no //
translated: â€œExternalâ€ means the Great White Maiden, and so on.

original: gang phyir mtho ris mchod sbyin sogs //
analyzed: gang phyir mtho ris mchod sbyin sogs //
translated: You say, â€œBecause heaven and so on are related to

original: dbang 'das 'brel pa su yis mthong //
analyzed: dbang 'das 'brel pa su yis mthong //
translated: sacrifice and so on, who sees this?â€

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: To this we reply:

original: dbang po las 'das don 'brel pa'i //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das don 'brel pa'i //
translated: â€œBecause the meaning of the Vedas is related to something beyond the senses,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.â€

original: 'dis ni rig byed kyi don shes par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni skyes bu la brten pa'i bshad pa nyid las zhes khyed cag rang nyid kyi shugs kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rig byed kyi don shes par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni skyes bu la brten pa'i bshad pa nyid las zhes khyed cag rang nyid kyi shugs kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the meaning of the Vedas is known by means of the explanations that are based on the person, which you yourself have implicitly taught.

original: 'di ltar re zhig don la brten pa'i nus pa 'di thams cad rang bzhin gyis @210b dbang po las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig don la brten pa'i nus pa 'di thams cad rang bzhin gyis @210b dbang po las 'das pa yin te /
translated: For, first, this capacity that is based on the meaning is by nature beyond the senses.

original: de lta yin dang nus pa dbang po las 'das pa yin pa ni sgra'i nges par sbyor ba skyes bus byas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang nus pa dbang po las 'das pa yin pa ni sgra'i nges par sbyor ba skyes bus byas pa ma yin la /
translated: If that were so, then the capacity would be beyond the senses, and the application of the term â€œVedaâ€ would not be made by a person.

original: de dag thams cad mngon par mi shes pa yin pa'i phyir long ba rnams kyis tshig las gzugs kyi khyad par rtogs pa de bzhin du de'i rtog pa rgan po dag las 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad mngon par mi shes pa yin pa'i phyir long ba rnams kyis tshig las gzugs kyi khyad par rtogs pa de bzhin du de'i rtog pa rgan po dag las 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: All of them are blind because they do not have direct perception. Just as the blind, by their own words, understand the particular of form, in the same way, the old ideas of the old men do not arise.

original: de lta bas na shugs kyis don rtogs pa'i 'di skyes bu'i bshad pa nyid las rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na shugs kyis don rtogs pa'i 'di skyes bu'i bshad pa nyid las rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this understanding of the meaning by implication is established by the explanation of the person,

original: go skabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: go skabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa yin no //
translated: because there is no other opportunity. This is what is taught.

original: 'on te ba rgal zhing brtags pa 'di /
analyzed: 'on te ba rgal zhing brtags pa 'di /
translated: But if this is investigated,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan dag rtsod par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan dag rtsod par byed do //
translated: others argue as follows.

original: 'on te 'di ni skyes bus byas pa'i lung dag la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni skyes bus byas pa'i lung dag la yang mtshungs te /
translated: But this is the same for the scriptures composed by persons.

original: 'di ltar da ltar ba rnams kyis ci lkog tu gur pa'i ston pa po sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i don tshig rnams kyi don bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar da ltar ba rnams kyis ci lkog tu gur pa'i ston pa po sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i don tshig rnams kyi don bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed dam /
translated: In this way, do the present ones understand the meaning of the words of the teachers such as the Buddha, who are hidden from view, exactly as intended?

original: 'on kyang phyin ci log tu yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyin ci log tu yin zhes bya'o //
translated: But it is said to be the opposite.

original: ma yin de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs te /
analyzed: ma yin de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs te /
translated: The reply to that is â€œNo, because of the existence of that . . .â€ and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho na'i don bar bya ba la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid thabs dang bcas pa skyes bus nye bar bstan pa la ste /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho na'i don bar bya ba la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid thabs dang bcas pa skyes bus nye bar bstan pa la ste /
translated: â€œ Thatâ€ refers to the reality of the object of human activity, such as the object to be accomplished, etc., together with the means, which is taught by the person.

original: 'di ltar de la rigs pa nyid rjes su myong bar byed pa'i blo bzangs bde bar gshegs pa dag rab tu 'jug gi / grags pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la rigs pa nyid rjes su myong bar byed pa'i blo bzangs bde bar gshegs pa dag rab tu 'jug gi / grags pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the intelligent, the Well-Gone Ones, engage in that, having experienced it themselves, and not just on the basis of hearsay.

original: dad pas zhes bya ba ni mngon par yid ches pa ste /
analyzed: dad pas zhes bya ba ni mngon par yid ches pa ste /
translated: â€œ Faithâ€ means full confidence.

original: rigs par sems pa las skyes pa'i nges pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs par sems pa las skyes pa'i nges pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means certainty born of reflection on the reason.

original: tshad mas grub pa'i don kho na la yid mngon par ches par rigs pa'i phyir gzhan du ni ma yin te /ğŸ”½de la the tshom ma log pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa'i don kho na la yid mngon par ches par rigs pa'i phyir gzhan du ni ma yin te / de la the tshom ma log pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is proper to have full confidence in the object established by valid cognition, and not otherwise.ğŸ”½Because doubt has not been eliminated in regard to that.

original: don med pa'i the tshom ma log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa'i the tshom ma log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because doubt about the object has not been eliminated.

original: don la the tshom gyis zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa'i mthos ris dang lha la sogs pa shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don la ste /
analyzed: don la the tshom gyis zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa'i mthos ris dang lha la sogs pa shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don la ste /
translated: In fact, â€œdoubtâ€ refers to the meaning of something that is extremely hidden, such as the past, future, and the gods.

original: 'di ltar de la skyes bus byas pa'i tshig la skyes bu rang nyid kyi bsam pa brtan pa phyin ci ma log pa'i gdams ngag srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la skyes bus byas pa'i tshig la skyes bu rang nyid kyi bsam pa brtan pa phyin ci ma log pa'i gdams ngag srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is possible that the words of a person are the unmistaken advice of that personâ€™s own stable thoughts.

original: nyan pa po'i rgyud pa yang rgyun ma chad pa na gdams ngag yang dag pa srid pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan pa po'i rgyud pa yang rgyun ma chad pa na gdams ngag yang dag pa srid pa yin gyi /
translated: Also, if the continuum of the listener is unbroken, it is possible that the advice is correct.

original: de ltar skyes bus ma byas pa la ni ma byin te /
analyzed: de ltar skyes bus ma byas pa la ni ma byin te /
translated: But if it is not made by a person, it is not given.

original: de la ston pa po med pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½gzhan yang ston pa po brtse bas 'jig rten gyis @211a * //
analyzed: de la ston pa po med pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang ston pa po brtse bas 'jig rten gyis @211a * //
translated: This is because there is no teacher.

original: shes par bya ba'i phyir smra ba na 'jig rten gyi brda nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs nas smra bas /
analyzed: shes par bya ba'i phyir smra ba na 'jig rten gyi brda nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs nas smra bas /
translated: Moreover, when a teacher speaks out of love in order to make the world understand, he speaks by following the conventions of the world.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten la grags pa las kyang don de 'grub par 'gyur gyi de la 'dod pa med pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten la grags pa las kyang don de 'grub par 'gyur gyi de la 'dod pa med pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that meaning is established by what is renowned in the world, but it is not unfabricated because it is not asserted in that way.

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir khyed cag lung gang yang rung bas 'jug par mi 'gyur te /ğŸ”½thams cad du the tshom za bar mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'di bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir khyed cag lung gang yang rung bas 'jug par mi 'gyur te / thams cad du the tshom za bar mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'di bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, then why do you not engage in any scripture?ğŸ”½Because there is doubt in all cases.

original: mngon sum dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di smos te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di smos te /
translated: In order to dispel this qualm, he says, â€œDirect perception and inference,â€ and so on.

original: gang la the tshom za na yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis mngon par 'dod pa'i don de lta bu yin pa mi 'gal ba des 'jug pa na mdzes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang la the tshom za na yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis mngon par 'dod pa'i don de lta bu yin pa mi 'gal ba des 'jug pa na mdzes pa yin gyi /
translated: When there is doubt, it is not contradictory for direct perception and inference to ascertain that the intended meaning is as it is. It is beautiful to engage in that way.

original: gang de lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir mi snang ba de la tshad ma'i stobs kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang de lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir mi snang ba de la tshad ma'i stobs kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: But if it is not like that, it does not appear. It is not the case that it is not the power of valid knowledge.

original: don du mi 'gyur ba'i the tshom tsam skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don du mi 'gyur ba'i the tshom tsam skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because doubt alone arises that is not useful.

original: gal te de lta na rig byed la yang rigs pa 'dis 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /ğŸ”½rig byed sgra la de lta min //
analyzed: gal te de lta na rig byed la yang rigs pa 'dis 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na / rig byed sgra la de lta min //
translated: If that is so, then this reasoning would also apply to the Vedas.ğŸ”½The Vedas are not like that.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Vedas are not like that.

original: rang las rtogs zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyi tshad mar gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang las rtogs zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyi tshad mar gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of â€œunderstood from itselfâ€ is that they are valid cognitions in and of themselves.

original: des na tshad mas brtags nas de la 'jug par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na tshad mas brtags nas de la 'jug par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to engage in them after investigating them with valid cognition,

original: gzhan las tshad ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan las tshad ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would then follow that they are valid cognitions in relation to something else.

original: des ni yul gnyis rnam par dag pa srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: des ni yul gnyis rnam par dag pa srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not possible for the two objects to be pure in that way.

original: 'di ltar rig byed du snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bo 'chi 'pho ba dang skyed pa'i ngo bo can gyi gang zag ni rim gyis byed pa po yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rig byed du snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bo 'chi 'pho ba dang skyed pa'i ngo bo can gyi gang zag ni rim gyis byed pa po yin gyi /
translated: Thus, in the Vedas, the person who is the nature of death and transmigration in the past and the nature of birth in the future is the agent in sequence.

original: las dang 'bras bu la longs spyod pa yin no zhes rigs byed las 'don pa yin la de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bdag rtag par bshad zin to //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu la longs spyod pa yin no zhes rigs byed las 'don pa yin la de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bdag rtag par bshad zin to //
translated: The Vedas state that he is the one who experiences the results of karma, but that is unreasonable, as has been explained in the refutation of a permanent self.

original: de bzhin du dngos po 'ga' zhig rtag pa nyid du 'don pa de yang brtan pa'i dngos po rtag par mi rigs pa nyid du bstan zin to //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po 'ga' zhig rtag pa nyid du 'don pa de yang brtan pa'i dngos po rtag par mi rigs pa nyid du bstan zin to //
translated: So too, the assertion that some things are permanent has been explained as untenable with respect to stable things.

original: de bzhin du spyi la sogs pa mngon sum ma yin pa yang mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa dang / de bzhin du rim gyis skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa rnams dngos po la mi srid pa yang bstan pa dang / de bzhin du khyad par du byar med pa sngar byed pa po ma yin pa gzhan la ltos nas skyed par byed pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du spyi la sogs pa mngon sum ma yin pa yang mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa dang / de bzhin du rim gyis skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa rnams dngos po la mi srid pa yang bstan pa dang / de bzhin du khyad par du byar med pa sngar byed pa po ma yin pa gzhan la ltos nas skyed par byed pa nyid dang /
translated: So too, the assertion that universals and so on are not direct perception but are direct perception has been explained as untenable. So too, the impossibility of arising, enduring, and disintegrating sequentially in things has been explained. So too, the impossibility of a cause that is not a producer previously, without relying on another, has been explained.

original: de bzhin du grub zin pa bya ba ma yin pa yang gzhan la brten nas @211b gnas pa bstan pa dang / de bzhin du rgyus 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma dang 'gal ba rnam pa mang po dmigs na /
analyzed: de bzhin du grub zin pa bya ba ma yin pa yang gzhan la brten nas @211b gnas pa bstan pa dang / de bzhin du rgyus 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma dang 'gal ba rnam pa mang po dmigs na /
translated: So too, the impossibility of an established base that is not an action, relying on another, has been explained. So too, the many contradictions with valid knowledge, such as â€œdestruction by a cause,â€ have been observed.

original: de ji ltar de lta bur gyur ba'i lung gi rtog pa dang ldan pa 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar de lta bur gyur ba'i lung gi rtog pa dang ldan pa 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: So how could one who has such a scriptural view engage in this?

original: gang yang gzhon nu ma len gyi 'brel ba rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed pa gzhan smras pa de ni 'phral la byas pa'i gtam rgyud kyi ngo bo zlos gar la sogs pas ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½'phral bcas don can gtan rgyud chos //
analyzed: gang yang gzhon nu ma len gyi 'brel ba rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed pa gzhan smras pa de ni 'phral la byas pa'i gtam rgyud kyi ngo bo zlos gar la sogs pas ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / 'phral bcas don can gtan rgyud chos //
translated: Moreover, in order to prove that the relationship of Arjuna and Krishna is permanent, another proof is stated. But that is indefinite because of the nature of a story that is composed on the spot, such as a play.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says,ğŸ”½The story has the nature of a composition on the spot.

original: brtags pa'i don gtam rgyud gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste ;ğŸ”½'di ni 'phral byas pa'i don yang yin la /
analyzed: brtags pa'i don gtam rgyud gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste ; 'di ni 'phral byas pa'i don yang yin la /
translated: That which has the meaning of a story that is imagined is called that.

original: gtam rgyud kyang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gtam rgyud kyang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: This is a composition on the spot and it is a story. The words are combined in this way.

original: de'i chos ni 'dod pas bkod pa'i don nyid do //
analyzed: de'i chos ni 'dod pas bkod pa'i don nyid do //
translated: Its nature is the meaning that is arranged by desire.ğŸ”½What is that?

original: de ci zhig brjod pa yin zhe na /ğŸ”½sgra don thog ma med rtogs pa //
analyzed: de ci zhig brjod pa yin zhe na / sgra don thog ma med rtogs pa //
translated: He says,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The meaning of the words is understood without a beginning.

original: sgra ni yi ge'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra ni yi ge'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Sound is the nature of letters.

original: de'i don ni ci ste de dag thog ma med pa yin pa'i phyir nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba yang thog ma med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni ci ste de dag thog ma med pa yin pa'i phyir nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba yang thog ma med pa nyid yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: Since those are beginningless, the relation characterized by potentiality is also beginningless.

original: nus pa las dngos po tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa las dngos po tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Because the thing is not different from the potentiality.

original: de bzhin du 'brel ba byed pa'i thabs med pa'i phyir 'brel ba mi byed par rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'brel ba byed pa'i thabs med pa'i phyir 'brel ba mi byed par rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, because there is no means of making a relation, it is inferred that a relation is not made.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang byed pa'i thabs dang 'brel ba de ni de byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang byed pa'i thabs dang 'brel ba de ni de byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is devoid of the means of making a relation does not make that,

original: dper na 'ji ba dang dbyu gu dang 'khor lo dang chu dang skud pa la sogs pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa med pa'i rdza mkhan gyi bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'ji ba dang dbyu gu dang 'khor lo dang chu dang skud pa la sogs pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa med pa'i rdza mkhan gyi bum pa bzhin no //
translated: like a potterâ€™s pot, which is devoid of the collection of causes such as clay, a stick, a wheel, water, and thread.

original: skyes bu thams cad kyang 'brel ba byed pa'i thabs dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu thams cad kyang 'brel ba byed pa'i thabs dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //

analyzed: skyes bu 'di ni bdag ste sngar gong du bdag med pa grub pa la gnod pa bstan to //
translated: This soul is the self, and it has been shown that the prior nonexistence of the self is not established.

original: de'i phyir 'di nges par ma grub pa nyid yin no //ğŸ”½'on te skul bar byed pa ni bya ba la 'jug pa'i tshig la brjod do zhes bshad pa'i phyir rig byed kyi phyogs gcig gi khyad par nyid skul bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di nges par ma grub pa nyid yin no // 'on te skul bar byed pa ni bya ba la 'jug pa'i tshig la brjod do zhes bshad pa'i phyir rig byed kyi phyogs gcig gi khyad par nyid skul bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is not established.

original: rig byed thams cad ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rig byed thams cad ni ma yin te /
translated: Or, if it is said that the word â€œsoulâ€ is used in the sense of that which impels, since it is said that the word â€œsoulâ€ is used in the sense of that which impels one to engage in action, then the word â€œsoulâ€ refers to a specific part of the Veda, not to the entire Veda.

original: 'dir skul bar byed par bskyed pa'i blo phyogs su bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir skul bar byed par bskyed pa'i blo phyogs su bya ste /
translated: If that is so, then the word â€œsoulâ€ is used in the sense of that which impels the mind to generate the Veda,

original: de lta yin dang don gzhan gyi rig byed la gnod na yang skul bar byed pa la gnod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs grub pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin dang don gzhan gyi rig byed la gnod na yang skul bar byed pa la gnod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs grub pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: because if the Veda of another meaning is refuted, the soul that impels the mind to generate the Veda is not refuted, and therefore the reason is established.

original: skyon 'di med de skul bar byed pa smos pas 'ga' zhig tu rig byed kyi tshig thams cad brjod kyi /
analyzed: skyon 'di med de skul bar byed pa smos pas 'ga' zhig tu rig byed kyi tshig thams cad brjod kyi /
translated: This fault does not arise, because when the word â€œsoulâ€ is used, sometimes all the words of the Veda are referred to.

original: thams cad du 'jug par byed pa nyid ma yin te /ğŸ”½'di ltar 'byung po rnams la 'tshe bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du 'jug par byed pa nyid ma yin te / 'di ltar 'byung po rnams la 'tshe bar mi bya'o //
translated: It does not motivate all,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di skul bar byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di skul bar byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: because the words â€œdo not harm living beingsâ€ would not motivate one to engage in harming living beings,

original: 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not motivate one to engage in that.

original: gang yang bshad pa las 'di la don dang don ma yin pa gnyi ga skul bar byed pa mtshon pa yin no zhes bya ba gang smras pa de yang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: gang yang bshad pa las 'di la don dang don ma yin pa gnyi ga skul bar byed pa mtshon pa yin no zhes bya ba gang smras pa de yang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Also, the statement in the commentary that â€œit indicates both the object and the nonobjectâ€ is contradictory,

original: gang gi des don med pa mtshon pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba skul bar byed pa don med pa la 'jug par byed pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: gang gi des don med pa mtshon pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba skul bar byed pa don med pa la 'jug par byed pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no ;
translated: because it is not the case that that which indicates the nonobject motivates one to engage in the nonobject.

original: / gzhan yang bshad pa las gzhan 'di yang bshad de /
analyzed: / gzhan yang bshad pa las gzhan 'di yang bshad de /
translated: Also, the following is stated in the commentary:

original: skyes bus byas pa'i tshig las byung ba'i shes pa 'ga' zhig 'khrul pa yin gyi /
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa'i tshig las byung ba'i shes pa 'ga' zhig 'khrul pa yin gyi /
translated: Some consciousnesses that arise from words created by persons are mistaken,

original: rig byed ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rig byed ni ma yin te /
translated: but the Vedas are not.

original: log pa nyid la ni tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zer ba la skul ba kho na chos dang chos ma yin pa la @215b sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: log pa nyid la ni tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zer ba la skul ba kho na chos dang chos ma yin pa la @215b sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
translated: But in the case of the false, there is not even the slightest valid cognition.

original: snang bar gyur ba srog chags thams cad kyi thun mong gi mig lta bur gnas pas so //
analyzed: snang bar gyur ba srog chags thams cad kyi thun mong gi mig lta bur gnas pas so //
translated: The reason for positing Dharma and non-Dharma, etc. is that it is the cause of the appearance that exists as the common eye of all living beings.

original: gzhan skyes bus bstan pa'i tshig la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan skyes bus bstan pa'i tshig la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the words taught by another person.

original: grub pas kyang 'di ltar rgyu nyid grub par byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: grub pas kyang 'di ltar rgyu nyid grub par byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: And it is also said that the proof is established in this way.

original: gang gi tshe byed pa po med pa dang rtag pa'i skyes bu'i yul gyi rig byed kyi tshig gi gnod pa gsal bar mthong ba de'i tshe me'i sbyin sreg gis mtho ris su 'gyur ba la sogs pa la yang gnod par dogs pa bzlog par dka' bar gsal
analyzed: gang gi tshe byed pa po med pa dang rtag pa'i skyes bu'i yul gyi rig byed kyi tshig gi gnod pa gsal bar mthong ba de'i tshe me'i sbyin sreg gis mtho ris su 'gyur ba la sogs pa la yang gnod par dogs pa bzlog par dka' bar gsal
translated: When one clearly sees the refutation of the object of the eternal person who is not an agent, then it is difficult to avoid the fear of refuting heaven and so on that is attained by fire sacrifice.

original: ba re zhig the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa nyid sngar bstan pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ba re zhig the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa nyid sngar bstan pa kho na'o //
translated: The non-establishment of doubt was already explained before.

original: de nyid kyi phyir the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa nyid yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa nyid yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that the reason is unestablished because of doubt,

original: lag mthil zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lag mthil zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, â€œThe palm of the hand, etc.â€

original: de la zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus dang skyes bu gzhan la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus dang skyes bu gzhan la'o //
translated: â€œ In that caseâ€ means in regard to place, time, and person.ğŸ”½Since it is not the case that the palm of the hand, etc., is not perceived in another place, at another time, or by another person, therefore, the reason is unestablished because of doubt.

original: de la 'di ni yul gzhan dang dus gzhan dang skyes bu gzhan la ldog pa ma yin pas de'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa yin no zhes gang smras pa de ni 'di nyid kyis sun phyung ba yin no //ğŸ”½de'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad kyi //
analyzed: de la 'di ni yul gzhan dang dus gzhan dang skyes bu gzhan la ldog pa ma yin pas de'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa yin no zhes gang smras pa de ni 'di nyid kyis sun phyung ba yin no // de'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad kyi //
translated: Thus, the statement that â€œit is not erroneous because it is not the case that the palm of the hand, etc., is not perceived in another place, at another time, or by another personâ€ is refuted by this.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la /
translated: Therefore, he says, â€œIn that case, the entire world would not be the object of knowledge of all beings.â€

original: skyes bus mi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skyes bus mi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, he says, â€œThe nature of the object of knowledge of all beings is not known by all beings.â€

original: ngo bo ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ngo bo ni rang bzhin no //
translated: â€œ Natureâ€ means essence.

original: don ni brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: don ni brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: â€œ Objectâ€ means that which is to be expressed.

original: 'di la skyes bus mi shes pa'i ngo bo dang don yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la skyes bus mi shes pa'i ngo bo dang don yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase should be construed as follows: â€œThe nature and object of the object of knowledge of all beings is not known by all beings.â€

original: de la ci yi ge 'di nyid yin nam /
analyzed: de la ci yi ge 'di nyid yin nam /
translated: In that case, is the nature of the object of knowledge of all beings the same as all beings?

original: 'on te / gzhan yin /
analyzed: 'on te / gzhan yin /
translated: Or is it different from all beings?

original: yi ge'i rim pa'i khyad par 'di yin nam /
analyzed: yi ge'i rim pa'i khyad par 'di yin nam /
translated: Is this the difference in the order of the letters?

original: 'on te ma yin zhes ngo bo mi shes te /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes ngo bo mi shes te /
translated: Or is it not? We do not know the nature of the matter,

original: rang dang gzhan las nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan las nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to ascertain it from ourselves or from others.

original: de bzhin du don la yang ma nges pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du don la yang ma nges pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, we should see that the meaning is not ascertained.

original: de lta yin dang mun pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang mun pa yin te /
translated: If that were so, it would be darkness,

original: nges pa med par snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa med par snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not appear without ascertainment.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ba lang can gyi mchod sbyin la sogs pa la bar sig pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ba lang can gyi mchod sbyin la sogs pa la bar sig pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: â€œIn the same wayâ€ means like the Barhishad sacrifice, etc. for the Barhishad sacrificer, etc.

original: sngon gyi sdig pa goms pa'i bag chags ni de'i rgyu mthun pa'i nus pa la sogs pa'i stan bcos 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi sdig pa goms pa'i bag chags ni de'i rgyu mthun pa'i nus pa la sogs pa'i stan bcos 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The latent impressions of previously committed sins are the basis for the power of their natural outcome, etc.

original: dang po nyid du chos dang chos ma yin pa don du gnyer ba'i rtog pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu rnams kyis gdon mi za bar skul bar byed pa nyid tshad ma nyid du bstan par bya ba ste /
analyzed: dang po nyid du chos dang chos ma yin pa don du gnyer ba'i rtog pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu rnams kyis gdon mi za bar skul bar byed pa nyid tshad ma nyid du bstan par bya ba ste /
translated: First of all, for those who seek dharma and adharma, the person who definitely instigates them should be taught to be valid cognition.

original: re zhig rigs pas gnod pa'i phyir skul ba yang rigs pas @216a * //
analyzed: re zhig rigs pas gnod pa'i phyir skul ba yang rigs pas @216a * //
translated: For the time being, the instigator is also harmed by reasoning, since he is harmed by reasoning.

original: gnod pa bzlog par dka' ba nyid srid pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa bzlog par dka' ba nyid srid pa yin no //
translated: It is possible that it is difficult to avert the harm.

original: 'di ltar gzhon nu ma len gyis //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhon nu ma len gyis //
translated: Thus, Kumarila says:

original: ma byas pa nyid ces gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: ma byas pa nyid ces gang smras pa de la /
translated: â€œIt is not done.â€

original: de'i phyir chos la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, â€œThe Dharma,â€ and so on.

original: chos smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: chos smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The mention of the Dharma is an illustration.

original: chos ma yin pa yang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa yang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The non-Dharma should also be taken.

original: de lta na 'o na chos la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i rten gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na chos la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i rten gang yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, what is the basis for the establishment of the Dharma and so on?

original: de'i phyir ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, â€œWisdom,â€ and so on.

original: nang gi mun pa ni nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi mun pa ni nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ste /
translated: Inner darkness is afflicted and unafflicted ignorance.

original: ye shes kyi snang bas nang gi mun pa'i phung po 'jig pa ste gang gi sel ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi snang bas nang gi mun pa'i phung po 'jig pa ste gang gi sel ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The destruction of the mass of inner darkness by the light of wisdom is the removal of that. That is what is called â€œthe destruction of the mass of inner darkness by the light of wisdom.â€

original: rnam g-yem pa'i zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa gtsang ba rnams te /
analyzed: rnam g-yem pa'i zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa gtsang ba rnams te /
translated: â€œThose who are not distractedâ€ means those who are pure, without fault.

original: phyugs gsod pa dang 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa la sogs pa'i dri mas ma gos pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //ğŸ”½ston mdzad skyes bu 'dod par gyis //
analyzed: phyugs gsod pa dang 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa la sogs pa'i dri mas ma gos pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to // ston mdzad skyes bu 'dod par gyis //
translated: The meaning is that they are not stained by the defilements of killing animals and sexual misconduct.

original: zhes bya ba ni de lta na ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid de rtag pa don dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de lta na ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid de rtag pa don dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: â€œYou should desire the person who teaches thatâ€ means that if it were that way, then it would not be created by a person, and it would be eternal and meaningful.

original: de lta ma yin na mi shes pa'i don la de don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi shes pa'i don la de don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then the meaning of the unknown would be meaningless.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is taught by this.

original: khyod kyis thos pa tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa med par mi rigs pas de lta bas na 'di gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyis thos pa tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa med par mi rigs pas de lta bas na 'di gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Whatever you accept as valid cognition, that is not reasonable without omniscience. Therefore, this must be accepted without doubt.

original: gzhan du na tshad ma nyid du mi 'grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na tshad ma nyid du mi 'grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it is not established as valid cognition.

original: 'di yang 'di skad du bstan pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang 'di skad du bstan pa nyid yin te /
translated: This also is taught in this way:

original: tshad mas 'thad pa'i tshig chos la sogs pa la brten pa mchog yin la rag mod /
analyzed: tshad mas 'thad pa'i tshig chos la sogs pa la brten pa mchog yin la rag mod /
translated: It is certainly the case that the supreme basis is the words of the Dharma that are established by valid cognition.

original: de lta na yang skyes bus ma byas pa brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de lta na yang skyes bus ma byas pa brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: However, what is the point of investigating whether or not they are composed by a person?

original: gang yang chos la sogs pa rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyis kyang rtogs par bya ba ma yin no zhes smras pa de yang lhag ma dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang chos la sogs pa rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyis kyang rtogs par bya ba ma yin no zhes smras pa de yang lhag ma dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Also, the statement that even the Dharma, etc., are not to be realized by the direct perception of a yogi is incomplete,ğŸ”½because the inference of a yogi will be established later.

original: rnal 'byor pa rjes su dpag pa ni phyis bsgrub par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rjes su dpag pa ni phyis bsgrub par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is the thought.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las thos pa brtag pa ste nyi shu dgu pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las thos pa brtag pa ste nyi shu dgu pa'o /
translated: This concludes the twenty-ninth chapter of the Commentary on the Compendium of Principles, the analysis of hearing.

original: // / de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas yang rang dbang thob la ma zhen pa nyid rnam pa gzhan gyis sgrub par byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: // / de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas yang rang dbang thob la ma zhen pa nyid rnam pa gzhan gyis sgrub par byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: Again, the nonattachment of one who has attained independence is established in another way, beginning with â€œThus.â€

original: 'di ltar rgyal dpog pa rnams ni ci nas kyang thos pa @216b tshad ma nyid du bya'o snyam pa na spyir tshad ma thams cad rang las tshad ma nyid yin la tshad ma ma yin pa ni gzhan las so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyal dpog pa rnams ni ci nas kyang thos pa @216b tshad ma nyid du bya'o snyam pa na spyir tshad ma thams cad rang las tshad ma nyid yin la tshad ma ma yin pa ni gzhan las so zhes zer ro //
translated: In this way, the Jaina say that all valid knowledge is valid knowledge by itself, and invalid knowledge is invalid knowledge by itself.

original: gzhan las tshad ma nyid yin na thug pa med pa la sogs pa'i skyon du thal ba'i phyir tshad ma dang gcig shos kyi rnam par gzhag pa rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan las tshad ma nyid yin na thug pa med pa la sogs pa'i skyon du thal ba'i phyir tshad ma dang gcig shos kyi rnam par gzhag pa rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If valid knowledge were valid knowledge by itself, and invalid knowledge were invalid knowledge by itself, then the presentation of valid knowledge and its opposite would be cut off, because the error of infinite regress would ensue.

original: 'di ltar phyogs bzhir 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyogs bzhir 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: There are four possibilities:

original: res 'ga' tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa gnyi ga rang nyid las zhes bya ba ni dang po'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa gnyi ga rang nyid las zhes bya ba ni dang po'o //
translated: Sometimes both valid knowledge and invalid knowledge are by themselves. This is the first possibility.

original: gnyis pa ni res 'ga' gzhan nyid las so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni res 'ga' gzhan nyid las so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second is sometimes by another.

original: gsum pa ni tshad ma nyid ni gzhan las yin la tshad ma ma yin pa ni rang las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni tshad ma nyid ni gzhan las yin la tshad ma ma yin pa ni rang las zhes bya'o //
translated: The third is that valid knowledge is by another, and invalid knowledge is by itself.

original: bzhi ba ni 'di las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi ba ni 'di las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the opposite of this.

original: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /ğŸ”½'di ltar de gnyi ga gsal ba gcig la brten pa yin nam /
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te / 'di ltar de gnyi ga gsal ba gcig la brten pa yin nam /
translated: First, the first possibility is not so,ğŸ”½because in this way, are both based on one manifestation,

original: gsal ba tha dad pa la brten pa yin /
analyzed: gsal ba tha dad pa la brten pa yin /
translated: or are they based on different manifestations?

original: re zhig gsal ba gcig la phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma dang / cig shos kyi chos srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig gsal ba gcig la phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma dang / cig shos kyi chos srid pa ma yin te /
