translated: First, in one manifestation, the two cannot be based on each other, because they have the character of mutually excluding each other.

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are contradictory.

original: gsal ba tha dad pa la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba tha dad pa la yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, they are not based on different manifestations,

original: nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / nges pa'i rgyu med pa la yang tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ma 'dres pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / nges pa'i rgyu med pa la yang tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ma 'dres pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cause for certainty, and because it would follow that the presentation of valid cognition and invalid cognition would be mixed up without a cause for certainty.

original: de bzhin gnyi ga yang rang dbang can yin pa'i phyir 'di ni tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gnyi ga yang rang dbang can yin pa'i phyir 'di ni tshad ma'o //
translated: And likewise, because both are independent, it is not certain that this is valid cognition

original: 'di ni tshad ma ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni tshad ma ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and that is not valid cognition.

original: rtog pa mtshungs pas gnyi ga yang tha dad pa bsgribs pa'i phyir dang / gzhan nges par 'dzin pa'i rgyu khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa mtshungs pas gnyi ga yang tha dad pa bsgribs pa'i phyir dang / gzhan nges par 'dzin pa'i rgyu khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the similarity of the concepts, both are obscured by the difference, and because the cause of the ascertainment of the other is not accepted.

original: rnam par phye nas yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir 'di ni tshad ma yin la 'di ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par phye nas yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir 'di ni tshad ma yin la 'di ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the non-understanding of the distinction, it is not possible to establish that this is a valid cognition and that is not a valid cognition.

original: phyogs gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The second position is also not correct.

original: dang po gnyi ga'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i shes pa ni rang bzhin med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po gnyi ga'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i shes pa ni rang bzhin med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the consequence that the first cognition, which is free from the nature of both, would be without nature.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma dang / cig shos dag med pa la 'di'i ngo bo gzhan nges par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'di the tshom med par nye bar brjod pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma dang / cig shos dag med pa la 'di'i ngo bo gzhan nges par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'di the tshom med par nye bar brjod pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the nature of the other, which is characterized by the mutual exclusion of the valid cognitions, is not ascertained in the absence of the other, this would be inexpressible without doubt.

original: yang bshad pa /ğŸ”½re zhig 'gal phyir rang las ni //
analyzed: yang bshad pa / re zhig 'gal phyir rang las ni //
translated: Again it is said:ğŸ”½First, because of the contradiction,ğŸ”½it is not from itself.

original: gnyis med gzhan las kyang ma yin //
analyzed: gnyis med gzhan las kyang ma yin //
translated: Not from another either.

original: de ltar shes pa'i ngo bo ni //ğŸ”½rang bzhin med pa @217a * //
analyzed: de ltar shes pa'i ngo bo ni // rang bzhin med pa @217a * //
translated: The essence of such knowledge

original: nyid du thal //
analyzed: nyid du thal //
translated: would be established as essenceless.

original: shes pa'i gsal ba tha dad pas //
analyzed: shes pa'i gsal ba tha dad pas //
translated: Since the clarity of consciousness is different,

original: rig byed dang ni 'gal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rig byed dang ni 'gal bar 'gyur //
translated: it would contradict the Vedas.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni ltos med ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni ltos med ni //
translated: Thus, without depending on anything,

original: ci zhig gang rung nges mi byed //
analyzed: ci zhig gang rung nges mi byed //
translated: it would not ascertain anything at all.

original: ce'o // phyogs gsum pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ce'o // phyogs gsum pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there a third alternative,

original: thug pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /ğŸ”½'di ltar re zhig tshad mar gyur pa gzhan las tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: thug pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir te / 'di ltar re zhig tshad mar gyur pa gzhan las tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: because the error of infinite regress would ensue.

original: de ni rang nyid tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½tshad mar gyur pa las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rang nyid tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro // tshad mar gyur pa las kyang ma yin te /
translated: For example, it is not maintained that valid cognitions are valid cognitions in virtue of another valid cognition, because they are valid cognitions in virtue of themselves.

original: de la yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pas gzhan las tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pas gzhan las tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor are they valid cognitions in virtue of a valid cognition, because the same argument applies to that, and so if it is maintained that valid cognitions are valid cognitions in virtue of another, an infinite regress would ensue.

original: de lta yin na tshad ma'i gsal ba gcig rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma brgyud pa'i rjes su 'brangs pas skyes bu'i tshe mtha' dag dogs par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½de lta bas na go skabs gzhan med pa'i phyir tshad ma thams cad kyi tshad ma ni rang las yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin na tshad ma'i gsal ba gcig rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma brgyud pa'i rjes su 'brangs pas skyes bu'i tshe mtha' dag dogs par 'gyur ro // de lta bas na go skabs gzhan med pa'i phyir tshad ma thams cad kyi tshad ma ni rang las yin la /
translated: If that were so, then in order to establish a single instance of valid cognition, one would have to follow a series of valid cognitions, and so a personâ€™s entire life would be used up.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa nyid ni gzhan las zhes gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa nyid ni gzhan las zhes gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because there is no other alternative, all valid cognitions are valid cognitions in and of themselves, and all invalid cognitions are invalid cognitions in and of themselves.ğŸ”½This is how it should be understood.

original: de la sbyor ba ni gang dag gang gi rang bzhin du nges pa de dag ni de las gzhan la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba ni gang dag gang gi rang bzhin du nges pa de dag ni de las gzhan la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: The argument here is as follows: Whatever is ascertained as the nature of something does not depend on something else,

original: dper na nam mkha' lus can ma yin par bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' lus can ma yin par bya ba bzhin no //
translated: just as space is ascertained as not being a physical object.ğŸ”½The consciousness that is the basis of the dispute is ascertained as valid cognition.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang tshad ma nyid du nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang tshad ma nyid du nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradiction with a pervasion.

original: 'di ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not indeterminate.

original: rang las med pa'i chos ni gzhan gyis bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang las med pa'i chos ni gzhan gyis bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because a phenomenon that does not exist in itself cannot be made to exist by another.

original: nam mkha'i lus can nyid bzhin te //
analyzed: nam mkha'i lus can nyid bzhin te //
translated: It is like the body of space.

original: rang las nus pa med pa ni //
analyzed: rang las nus pa med pa ni //
translated: That which is powerless in itself

original: gzhan gyis bya bar nus ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bya bar nus ma yin //
translated: cannot be made powerful by another.

original: zhes gang bshad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa ma yin no //
translated: This is what has been explained.ğŸ”½Here, the meaning of the thesis is established by â€œall valid cognitions,â€ and so on.

original: 'dir tshad ma kun gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas dam bca' ba'i don gsog yin pa srid pa na rnam par dpyad pa'i sgo nas sun 'byin pa rtsom pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir tshad ma kun gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas dam bca' ba'i don gsog yin pa srid pa na rnam par dpyad pa'i sgo nas sun 'byin pa rtsom pa yin te /
translated: When it is possible, the refutation is begun by way of analysis.

original: don gang yin par 'dod ces 'dri ba la /ğŸ”½gzhan gyis gzhal bya rtogs la sogs //
analyzed: don gang yin par 'dod ces 'dri ba la / gzhan gyis gzhal bya rtogs la sogs //
translated: When asked, â€œWhat is the meaning of that?â€ğŸ”½The response is, â€œThe understanding of objects, and so on,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: of others.â€

original: gal te shes pa tsam yin na de'i tshe gzhal bar bya ba rtogs pa'i tshad ma de yongs su rtogs pa'i tshad gcod par byed pa la nus pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: gal te shes pa tsam yin na de'i tshe gzhal bar bya ba rtogs pa'i tshad ma de yongs su rtogs pa'i tshad gcod par byed pa la nus pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
translated: If it is mere consciousness, then at that time the valid knowledge that understands the object is the valid knowledge that fully comprehends the object, and it is by nature powerful.

original: shes pa ni don gcod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa ni don gcod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because consciousness is that which comprehends the object.

original: 'on te mig la sogs pa yin na de'i tshe de dag @217b don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa skyed par byed pa dang / skul bar byed pa la yang dbang po las 'das pa'i don rtogs par rang nyid kyis nus pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni sogs pa'i sgras gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te mig la sogs pa yin na de'i tshe de dag @217b don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa skyed par byed pa dang / skul bar byed pa la yang dbang po las 'das pa'i don rtogs par rang nyid kyis nus pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni sogs pa'i sgras gzung bar bya'o //
translated: But if it is the eye, etc., then at that time, since they generate consciousness in accordance with the object and they themselves are capable of realizing the object that is beyond the senses, this is what is to be understood by the term â€œetc.â€

original: 'di nyid la re zhig gzhan dag 'thad pa 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid la re zhig gzhan dag 'thad pa 'chad pa ni /
translated: Here, first, others explain the rationale:

original: rang nyid kyis med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: â€œThey themselves do not exist, etc.â€

original: 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //ğŸ”½ltos med gcig pu kho na nyid //
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir // ltos med gcig pu kho na nyid //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œThe one that is independent, etc.â€

original: tshad ma nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni tshad ma rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni tshad ma rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: â€œBy valid cognitionâ€ means that the establishment of valid cognition would be untenable.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni tshad ma nyid de khyab par byed pa log na khyab par bya ba mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni tshad ma nyid de khyab par byed pa log na khyab par bya ba mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œThat itselfâ€ refers to valid cognition. When the pervader is refuted, the pervaded does not remain.

original: 'di snyam du 'jig par 'gyur mod skyon ni ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'jig par 'gyur mod skyon ni ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If you think, â€œIt is true that it is destroyed, but what is the problem?â€

original: rigs pa smra ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rigs pa smra ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œThe proponent of reasonâ€ and so on.

original: rtsa ba ni tshad ma nyid de de yang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis 'phrog par byed de /
analyzed: rtsa ba ni tshad ma nyid de de yang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis 'phrog par byed de /
translated: The root is valid cognition, and that is undermined by the fact that it is dependent.

original: de ni de'i khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that contradicts the pervasion.

original: 'di ltar ltos pa med pa nyid kyis tshad ma nyid la khyab la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ltos pa med pa nyid kyis tshad ma nyid la khyab la /
translated: Thus, valid cognition is pervaded by the absence of dependence.

original: de yang ji ltar rang gis khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yod pa na gnas pa rnyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar rang gis khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yod pa na gnas pa rnyed par 'gyur /
translated: And just as that is pervaded by the absence of dependence, it is also pervaded by the presence of dependence, which is incompatible with the pervader.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma nyid la ltos pa med pa nyid kyis khyab par ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma nyid la ltos pa med pa nyid kyis khyab par ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: â€œBy whatâ€ and so on teaches that valid cognition is pervaded by the absence of dependence.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
translated: â€œBy whatâ€ means â€œbecause.â€

original: ji ltar 'jog par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jog par byed ce na /
translated: How is it posited?

original: ltos pa dang bcas zhes smos te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas zhes smos te /
translated: â€œIt is dependentâ€ is stated.

original: rnam par gzhag bya min zhes bya ba ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag bya min zhes bya ba ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œIt is not something to be positedâ€ because it would lead to an infinite regress.

original: thug pa med pa yin pa la rag mod ci nyes she na /
analyzed: thug pa med pa yin pa la rag mod ci nyes she na /
translated: If it is said that it is not tenable that the effect is produced from the assemblage of causes and conditions, then what is the fault?

original: thug pa med pa'i gtan tshigs can //
analyzed: thug pa med pa'i gtan tshigs can //
translated: If you say, â€œWhat is wrong with the fact that there is an infinite regress?,â€

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: we say:ğŸ”½The reason is infinite regress.

original: thug pa med pa ste ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: thug pa med pa ste ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has an infinite regress, i.e., an indefinite reason, is called that.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: shes par byed pa shes pa ni shes par bya ba'i don shes par byed kyi yod pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes par byed pa shes pa ni shes par bya ba'i don shes par byed kyi yod pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition that causes understanding causes the understanding of the object to be understood, but not merely existence.

original: de lta yin dang re zhig rgol ba rang nyid ma rtogs par ji ltar gzhan rtogs par bya ba'i don du sgrub par byed pa len par byed /
analyzed: de lta yin dang re zhig rgol ba rang nyid ma rtogs par ji ltar gzhan rtogs par bya ba'i don du sgrub par byed pa len par byed /
translated: If that were so, then how could the opponent first, without understanding himself, take up the proof in order to cause another to understand?

original: de lta'i don ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa rtsom par byed de //
analyzed: de lta'i don ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa rtsom par byed de //
translated: He begins the refutation with â€œThe meaning of that is . . . â€

original: de la rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don ci yin par 'dod /ğŸ”½ci rtag pa nyid kyis rgyu med pa'i phyir rang bzhin @218a * //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don ci yin par 'dod / ci rtag pa nyid kyis rgyu med pa'i phyir rang bzhin @218a * //
translated: What is the meaning of â€œnatureâ€ that you accept?

original: can yin nam /
analyzed: can yin nam /
translated: Is it that it is a nature because it is permanent and causeless?ğŸ”½Or is it that it is a nature because it is a cause?

original: 'on te mi rtag pa yin na yang rang gi rgyu dag las shes pa rnams kyis rang bzhin can grub pa'i dus kho nar 'byung ba yin gyi dus phyis rgyu gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin can yin zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa
analyzed: 'on te mi rtag pa yin na yang rang gi rgyu dag las shes pa rnams kyis rang bzhin can grub pa'i dus kho nar 'byung ba yin gyi dus phyis rgyu gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin can yin zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa
translated: But if it is impermanent, then consciousnesses that are by nature produced from their own causes arise only at the time they are produced, and not later, since they are not produced by other causes.

original: gnyis pas so //
analyzed: gnyis pas so //
translated: Therefore they are by nature.

original: de la re zhig rnam par rtog pa dang po ni ma yin te /ğŸ”½de tha dad pa yin nam /
analyzed: de la re zhig rnam par rtog pa dang po ni ma yin te / de tha dad pa yin nam /
translated: The first conception is not correct.

original: tha mi dad pa yin /ğŸ”½yang na gnyi ga'am /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa yin / yang na gnyi ga'am /
translated: Is it different or not different?ğŸ”½Or is it by nature both or neither?

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can yin zhes bya ba phyogs rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can yin zhes bya ba phyogs rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four possibilities.

original: de la re zhig dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not the first,ğŸ”½because the relation is not established and because it would follow that it would not be a nonthing.

original: 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dngos po med pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po thams cad kyi nus pa nyid ni tha mi dad pa yin no zhes rnam pa mang du bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dngos po med pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po thams cad kyi nus pa nyid ni tha mi dad pa yin no zhes rnam pa mang du bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We have already explained in many ways that the capacity of all things is not different.

original: 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: 'dod pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The effect of the desire, etc.

original: 'bras bu byed pa'i rgyu ni nus pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu byed pa'i rgyu ni nus pa yin te /
translated: The cause of the effect is the potential,

original: rang bzhin de yang dngos po'i bdag nyid du med pa na dngos po de byed pa por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin de yang dngos po'i bdag nyid du med pa na dngos po de byed pa por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and if that nature does not exist in the nature of the entity, then that entity would not be the agent.

original: de lta yin dang 'di dngos po med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'di dngos po med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is thought that it would follow that it would be a non-entity.

original: ci ste tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe rang bzhin can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe rang bzhin can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if the position is that they are not different, then they would not have the same nature,

original: don rgyu'i stobs kyis 'byung ba nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir de dang tha mi dad pa'i nus pa rnams kyang rgyu'i stobs kyis byung ba nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rgyu'i stobs kyis 'byung ba nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir de dang tha mi dad pa'i nus pa rnams kyang rgyu'i stobs kyis byung ba nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would be impermanent due to arising by the power of the cause, and it follows that the potentials that are not different from that would be impermanent due to arising by the power of the cause.

original: de lta ma yin na grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir tha mi dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir tha mi dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, they would not be non-different because they would be different in terms of establishment and happiness.

original: de nyid ni /
analyzed: de nyid ni /
translated: That is,

original: rang rgyu'i stobs las byung ba can //
analyzed: rang rgyu'i stobs las byung ba can //
translated: it arises from the power of its cause.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: gzhan yang tshad ma rnams las nus pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½nus pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du rtag pa nyid dang rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshad ma rnams las nus pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro // nus pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du rtag pa nyid dang rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because of the non-difference of potency from the valid cognitions,ğŸ”½it would be permanent and without cause, like the nature of potency.

original: nus pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: nus pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, â€œIt has the nature of potency,â€ and so on.

original: de lta yin dang skyon ci yod ce na /ğŸ”½rgyu med gzhan la mi ltos phyir //
analyzed: de lta yin dang skyon ci yod ce na / rgyu med gzhan la mi ltos phyir //
translated: If that were so, what is the fault?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, â€œBecause it is without cause and does not depend on another,â€ and so on.

original: rgyu med pa nyid yin na rtag tu med pa'am yod pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid yin na rtag tu med pa'am yod pa yin la /
translated: If it were without cause, it would be either permanently existent or non-existent.

original: rtag pa nyid yin na ni rtag tu yod pa ma brjod kyang grub pa nyid kyi @218b phyir ma bstan to //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid yin na ni rtag tu yod pa ma brjod kyang grub pa nyid kyi @218b phyir ma bstan to //
translated: If it were permanent, it would be permanently existent, but because it is established even without being stated, it is not taught.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba gzhan yang bshad pa ni de phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba gzhan yang bshad pa ni de phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Another absurd consequence is stated: â€œTherefore,â€ and so on.

original: de la rag las zhes bya ba ni tshad ma la rag las pa'o //
analyzed: de la rag las zhes bya ba ni tshad ma la rag las pa'o //
translated: â€œDependent onâ€ means dependent on valid cognition.

original: 'dis ni dam bca' ba mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i don dang 'gal bar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni dam bca' ba mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i don dang 'gal bar bstan pa yin te /
translated: This shows that the thesis contradicts both direct perception and inference.

original: 'di ltar tshad ma rnams kyis rang bzhin res 'ga' bar mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshad ma rnams kyis rang bzhin res 'ga' bar mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa yin la /
translated: For, by means of valid cognitions, the occasional nature is established by direct perception itself,

original: 'bras bu rim can dpog pa'i rjes su dpag pas kyang yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rim can dpog pa'i rjes su dpag pas kyang yin te /
translated: and by inference, the sequential effect is inferred.

original: de lta yin dang de rtag pa nyid du khas len pa la tshad ma gnyis kyis rab tu gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang de rtag pa nyid du khas len pa la tshad ma gnyis kyis rab tu gnod pa yin no //
translated: If that were the case, then the acceptance of its permanence would be thoroughly undermined by the two valid cognitions.

original: tshad ma rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
translated: The opponentâ€™s objection is stated in the lines beginning â€œThe nature of the valid cognitions . . .â€

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan dag ji skad du bshad pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba gnyis mi 'jug par sgrub par byed pa'i thabs dogs par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan dag ji skad du bshad pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba gnyis mi 'jug par sgrub par byed pa'i thabs dogs par byed de /
translated: They argue that the two absurd consequences that we have explained do not apply to them.

original: gang gi tshe gsal bar byed pa rnams kyis tshad ma'i rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byas pa de'i tshe de dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gsal bar byed pa rnams kyis tshad ma'i rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byas pa de'i tshe de dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: When the illuminators illuminate the nature of the valid cognitions, at that time they are observed.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin pas de'i phyir rtag pa nyid yin na yang thams cad du dmigs par thal bar mi 'gyur la 'bras bu rtag tu yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin pas de'i phyir rtag pa nyid yin na yang thams cad du dmigs par thal bar mi 'gyur la 'bras bu rtag tu yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'ang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not so in other cases, therefore, even though it is permanent, it does not follow that it is perceived everywhere, nor does it follow that the effect is always present.

original: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa nyid 'bras bu rtsom pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa nyid 'bras bu rtsom pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not alone that is accepted as the beginning of the effect, because it depends on other causes.

original: des na rgyu gzhan nye ba dang mi nye ba dag las 'bras bu res 'ga' ba nyid du 'gyur ba yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rgyu gzhan nye ba dang mi nye ba dag las 'bras bu res 'ga' ba nyid du 'gyur ba yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effect is sometimes present due to the proximity or non-proximity of other causes. This is the idea.

original: rtag pa'i dngos po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: rtag pa'i dngos po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed de /
translated: He replies with â€œIf there is a permanent entity...â€, etc.

original: gsal ba dang rgyu gzhan la ltos pa ni gsal ba dang rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dag go //
analyzed: gsal ba dang rgyu gzhan la ltos pa ni gsal ba dang rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dag go //
translated: The manifestation and dependence on other causes are the manifestation and dependence on other causes.

original: sngar thos pa brtag par rgyas par rtag pa'i gsal ba bkag zin la /
analyzed: sngar thos pa brtag par rgyas par rtag pa'i gsal ba bkag zin la /
translated: The manifestation of the permanent was previously refuted in detail in the examination of hearing.

original: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa yang phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa la rig pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa yang phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa la rig pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: And it has been shown that dependence on other causes is not tenable for what is not to be benefited.

original: de'i phyir de yi ngo bo dang // zhes bya ba la tshad ma dag gi ngo bo dang 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de yi ngo bo dang // zhes bya ba la tshad ma dag gi ngo bo dang 'bras bu ste /
translated: The nature of the valid cognitions and their result.

original: ngo bo ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ngo bo ni rang bzhin no //
translated: Nature means essence.

original: gnyi ga'i phyogs ni 'gal ba'i phyir dang ji skad du bshad pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la yod pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i phyogs ni 'gal ba'i phyir dang ji skad du bshad pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la yod pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical for both to exist in either position because the two positions are contradictory and the previously explained faults would ensue.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the case that neither exists.

original: phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo de dag ni gcig dgag pa gzhan sgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½@219a * // de nyid kyi tshe dgag pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo de dag ni gcig dgag pa gzhan sgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro // @219a * // de nyid kyi tshe dgag pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the essences that are mutually exclusive are such that the affirmation of one occurs only when the other is negated.ğŸ”½At that time, it is not logical to negate because it is contradictory for both affirmation and negation to exist in one.

original: gcig la sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig la sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is the thought.

original: sun 'byin pa shin tu gsal ba'i phyir ma brjod do //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa shin tu gsal ba'i phyir ma brjod do //
translated: Because the refutation is very clear, it is not stated.

original: da ni phyogs phyi ma gsum khas blangs nas sun 'byin pa 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: da ni phyogs phyi ma gsum khas blangs nas sun 'byin pa 'chad pa ni /
translated: Now, having accepted the latter three positions, the refutation is explained.

original: dngos po nus las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po nus las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: â€œFrom the capacity of the thingâ€ and so on.

original: logs shig ni tha dad pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: logs shig ni tha dad pa'i phyogs so //
translated: â€œApartâ€ means a different position.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The mention of â€œboth naturesâ€ is by way of illustration;

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyogs kang khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyogs kang khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: one should also accept the position of a nature that is neither.

original: yang na de la yang gnyi ga'i ngo bo dgag pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis gnyi ga'i bdag nyid spong pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na de la yang gnyi ga'i ngo bo dgag pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis gnyi ga'i bdag nyid spong pa nyid do //
translated: Or, in that case, the nature of both is refuted by the very refutation of both natures.

original: phyogs gsum pa 'di la yang shes pa nus pa rtag pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa 'di la yang shes pa nus pa rtag pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In this third position, consciousness would be permanent because it is related to permanent capacity.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says â€œOtherwise,â€ and so on.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is not so.

original: gal te nus pa dang 'brel ba'i shes pa mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur na de'i tshe nus pa rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nus pa dang 'brel ba'i shes pa mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur na de'i tshe nus pa rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If consciousness, which is related to capacity, were impermanent, then capacity would not be permanent.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: ngo bo gcig rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngo bo gcig rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no single nature that is related.

original: rang bzhin gcig rjes su 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig rjes su 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because there is no single nature that is related.

original: ngo bo gcig rjes su 'gro ba med pa de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: ngo bo gcig rjes su 'gro ba med pa de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very absence of a single nature that is related, he says,

original: gang phyir nus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang phyir nus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œbecause the capacity . . .â€ and so on.

original: shes pa mi rtag pa yin na nus pa de'i shes pa 'brel ba dang ma 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gnyis su 'gyur la /
analyzed: shes pa mi rtag pa yin na nus pa de'i shes pa 'brel ba dang ma 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gnyis su 'gyur la /
translated: If consciousness is impermanent, then that capacity would have a nature that is related to consciousness and a nature that is not related to consciousness.

original: gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis yod par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis yod par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable for a single thing to have two natures that are mutually contradictory.

original: gcig nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang tha dad pa'i tha snyad rgyun chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang tha dad pa'i tha snyad rgyun chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the consequence of the loss of oneness would follow and because the convention of difference would be interrupted.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: With reference to a second conception, he says, â€œIf it is said . . .â€ and so on.

original: des 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyi skyon 'chad do //
analyzed: des 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyi skyon 'chad do //
translated: He explains the error of proving what has already been established with the words â€œBy that . . .â€ and so on.

original: 'di ltar brtan pa dang mi brtan pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pas dngos po'i rnam pa gnyi ga yang cha med pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyis yongs su rdzogs pas dus phyis rkyen gzhan gyi bdag nyid du byed pa'i nus pa med par mi nus la /
analyzed: 'di ltar brtan pa dang mi brtan pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pas dngos po'i rnam pa gnyi ga yang cha med pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyis yongs su rdzogs pas dus phyis rkyen gzhan gyi bdag nyid du byed pa'i nus pa med par mi nus la /
translated: Thus, because the nature of stability and instability are different, and because the two aspects of the entity are partless, it is impossible for the entity to be able to produce another nature later on, since it is completely perfect by itself.

original: byed na yang don gzhan byed pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: byed na yang don gzhan byed pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it could, then it would be producing something else,

original: rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i nus pa byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i nus pa byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not producing its own nature.

original: nus pa dngos @219b po'i rang bzhin du khas mi len na yang dngos po byed pa po nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: nus pa dngos @219b po'i rang bzhin du khas mi len na yang dngos po byed pa po nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: If you do not accept that the capacity is the nature of the entity, then it follows that the entity is not a producer.

original: 'di snyam du cha med pa'i dngos po'i nus pa dus phyis mi byed mod /
analyzed: 'di snyam du cha med pa'i dngos po'i nus pa dus phyis mi byed mod /
translated: You may think that a partless entity does not produce at a later time,

original: cha dang bcas pa ci'i phyir ma yin snyam du sems pa la /ğŸ”½gang phyir 'gal ba'i chos ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: cha dang bcas pa ci'i phyir ma yin snyam du sems pa la / gang phyir 'gal ba'i chos ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: but why would a partless entity not produce?ğŸ”½In response, Aryadeva says, â€œBecause it has incompatible properties.â€

original: des ni zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
translated: â€œ Itâ€ refers to the entity that has incompatible properties.

original: mi brtan pa'i dngos po la khyad par sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: mi brtan pa'i dngos po la khyad par sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the unstable thing is

original: don kun skad cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don kun skad cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: as follows: All objects are momentary, etc.

original: 'bras bu 'gal la zhes bya ba'i don nges pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'gal la zhes bya ba'i don nges pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the phrase â€œthe effect is contradictoryâ€ is ascertained, etc.

original: lhag ma ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: gal te 'di snyam du khyed cag la rtsod pa med na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du khyed cag la rtsod pa med na /
translated: If you think that if there is no dispute with you,

original: 'o na ji ltar gzhan las tshad ma nyid du khas len par byed snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gzhan las tshad ma nyid du khas len par byed snyam du sems na /
translated: then how can you accept that there is valid knowledge in other systems?

original: de'i phyir 'di la blo bzang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la blo bzang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, â€œIn this regard, the wise, etc.â€

original: rang las zhes bya ba ni dus phyis 'byung ba'i 'bras bu mi slu ba la mi ltos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyams su myong ba tsam las so //
analyzed: rang las zhes bya ba ni dus phyis 'byung ba'i 'bras bu mi slu ba la mi ltos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyams su myong ba tsam las so //
translated: â€œFrom itselfâ€ means from the mere experience of the nature of consciousness that does not rely on a nondeceptive effect that occurs later.

original: rtogs par zhes bya ba ni nges par ro //
analyzed: rtogs par zhes bya ba ni nges par ro //
translated: â€œRealizesâ€ means ascertains.

original: 'di snyam du nus pa ni shes pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di snyam du nus pa ni shes pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The idea is that because the capacity is not different from consciousness,

original: shes pa gzung ba na de yang 'dzin par byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gzung ba na de yang 'dzin par byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: when consciousness is apprehended, it is also apprehended.

original: de ji ltar rtogs par byed pa mi nus snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de ji ltar rtogs par byed pa mi nus snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that it is impossible to understand that,

original: ji ltar gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the root text states, â€œthe realization and attainment of the object of knowledge that exists in that way.â€

original: rtogs pa dang thob pa dag ni rtogs pa thob pa dag te /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang thob pa dag ni rtogs pa thob pa dag te /
translated: Realization and attainment are realization and attainment.

original: ji ltar gnas pa'i shes bya'i dngos po'i rtogs pa dang thob pa gang yin pa de la de'i yul can gyi nus pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa'i shes bya'i dngos po'i rtogs pa dang thob pa gang yin pa de la de'i yul can gyi nus pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The realization and attainment of the object of knowledge that exists in that way is the capacity of the subject of that object.

original: 'ba' zhig las zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba dang rgyu'i yid yongs su shes pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig las zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba dang rgyu'i yid yongs su shes pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase â€œfrom just thatâ€ means that it is not dependent on the complete understanding of the nondeceptive mind.

original: ci'i phyir mi nus she na /ğŸ”½gang gi gsal snang rnam pa can //
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi nus she na / gang gi gsal snang rnam pa can //
translated: Why is it not possible?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /ğŸ”½skra shad la sogs mthong ba la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / skra shad la sogs mthong ba la //
translated: The root text states, â€œbecause it is not the clear appearance of that.â€ğŸ”½The phrase â€œin the perception of floating hair, etc.â€

original: zhes bya ba ni skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa mthong ba la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa mthong ba la'o //
translated: refers to the perception of floating hair, etc.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad du bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: yang nus pa nyams su myong ba de lta na yang tshad ma ma yin pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir 'khrul bas dug la sogs pa'i nus pa bzhin du nges par mi nus pa la goms pa la sogs pa'i gzhan la yang ltos pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba
analyzed: yang nus pa nyams su myong ba de lta na yang tshad ma ma yin pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir 'khrul bas dug la sogs pa'i nus pa bzhin du nges par mi nus pa la goms pa la sogs pa'i gzhan la yang ltos pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba
translated: Moreover, even though the potency is experienced, it is not a valid cognition, like a cognition that is similar to a valid cognition. Therefore, it is not possible to ascertain the potency of poison, etc., because it depends on other factors, such as habituation.

original: 'ba' zhig nges pa'i rgyu ma yin te /ğŸ”½cha @220a * //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig nges pa'i rgyu ma yin te / cha @220a * //
translated: Experience alone is not the cause of ascertainment.ğŸ”½The cause of ascertainment is the cognition that is the cause of the ascertainment of the potency of poison, etc.

original: gang la 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis yon tan gzhan sgro mi 'dogs par de kho nar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis yon tan gzhan sgro mi 'dogs par de kho nar nges pa yin no //
translated: The ascertainment is of the potency alone, not of the object, because the object is not ascertained in that way.

original: 'o na gang las de nges par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang las de nges par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of that ascertainment?

original: de phyir don byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de phyir don byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, â€œbecause it performs a function, etc.â€

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i shes pa'o //
translated: â€œAlsoâ€ refers to the causal cognition.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba nus pa'o //
translated: â€œThisâ€ refers to the potency.

original: byed pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan la ltos pa zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: byed pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan la ltos pa zhes 'brel to //
translated: â€œBecause it does not perform a functionâ€ is connected to â€œbecause it depends on other factors.â€

original: nges pa ni skyes bu la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa ni skyes bu la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ascertainment is based on a person.

original: de bskyed par bya'i don du rgyu gzhan la ltos par rigs kyis /
analyzed: de bskyed par bya'i don du rgyu gzhan la ltos par rigs kyis /
translated: It is proper that it depend on another cause for the purpose of generating it,

original: de bya ba'i don du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bya ba'i don du ni ma yin te /
translated: but not for the purpose of its activity,

original: de'i rten ni nus pa snga ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rten ni nus pa snga ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its basis is the prior potentiality.

original: nus pa yang dngos po grub pa dang lhan cig grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa yang dngos po grub pa dang lhan cig grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: And potentiality is established simultaneously with the established entity.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang dug la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang dug la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe bstan pa yin no //
translated: The example is stated in the line beginning with â€œjust asâ€ and ending with â€œlike poison, etc.â€

original: de las gzhan mtshungs mthong phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni dug la sogs pa de las gzhan dod gra dang / btung ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan mtshungs mthong phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni dug la sogs pa de las gzhan dod gra dang / btung ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The line beginning with â€œbecause the similar is seen in other casesâ€ means that in other cases similar to poison, etc.,ğŸ”½such as food and drink, etc.,

original: de dang mtshungs pa nyid 'dra ba nyid de mthong ngo zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //ğŸ”½'bras bu mjug thogs su med phyir //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa nyid 'dra ba nyid de mthong ngo zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro // 'bras bu mjug thogs su med phyir //
translated: the similar, i.e., the like, is seen.

original: zhes bya ba la 'bras bu ni brgyal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'bras bu ni brgyal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The line beginning with â€œbecause there is no effect immediately afterâ€ means that the effect is fainting, etc.

original: de mjug thogs nyid du med pa'i phyir zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te mjug thogs su 'bras bu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de mjug thogs nyid du med pa'i phyir zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te mjug thogs su 'bras bu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase because it does not exist immediately after that is to be construed with the word because; the meaning is because the effect does not exist immediately after that.

original: de bdag rnam par ma nges na //
analyzed: de bdag rnam par ma nges na //
translated: If the nature of that is not ascertained,

original: zhes bya ba ni dug la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rnam par ma nges na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dug la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rnam par ma nges na'o //
translated: if the nature of poison, etc. is not ascertained.ğŸ”½In the nature of that,

original: de'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba ni dug la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba ni dug la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: in the nature of poison, etc.ğŸ”½The ascertainment of its capacity,

original: de nus nges zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gnas pa'i shes bya'i dngos po rtogs pa dang thob pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nus nges zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gnas pa'i shes bya'i dngos po rtogs pa dang thob pa nges pa'o //
translated: the ascertainment of the realization and attainment of the object of knowledge in accordance with its mode of being.

original: dam bca' ba rang gi tshig dang yang 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dam bca' ba rang gi tshig dang yang 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the thesis contradicts its own words,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, moreover, etc.

original: ji ltar gzhan las grub ma yin //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan las grub ma yin //
translated: How can it be established from another?

original: zhes bya ba ni grub pa kho na ste don gyis go ba ni tshad ma gzhan yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni grub pa kho na ste don gyis go ba ni tshad ma gzhan yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that it is established, and the understanding of the meaning is another means of valid cognition.

original: de nyid 'jig pa kho nar 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid 'jig pa kho nar 'gyur //
translated: It would be destroyed in that very moment.

original: zhes bya ba ste ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is not certain, he says,

original: rang gi rgyu las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œFrom its own cause,â€ and so on.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify this, he says,

original: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: â€œIts nature,â€ and so on.

original: 'di snyam du gal te shes pa la ltos nas @220b tshad ma nyid du grub par byed pa de'i tshe kho bo cag la yang grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te shes pa la ltos nas @220b tshad ma nyid du grub par byed pa de'i tshe kho bo cag la yang grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If you think that if valid knowledge is established in reliance on consciousness, then for us it is the establishment of what has already been established,

original: 'di ltar re zhig shes pa don gyis go bas grub par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig shes pa don gyis go bas grub par 'dod de /
translated: because we assert that consciousness is established by the object itself.

original: nus pa de'i ngo bo tshad ma nyid smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: nus pa de'i ngo bo tshad ma nyid smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention that the nature of that capacity is valid knowledge?

original: don nges pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'bras bu bya ba la shes pa'i phyir ltos pa med pa yin pas de rang las zhes brjod pa de ni rang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don nges pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'bras bu bya ba la shes pa'i phyir ltos pa med pa yin pas de rang las zhes brjod pa de ni rang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the effect is understood by consciousness through the definition of ascertaining the object, it is not dependent. Therefore, when it is said that â€œit is from itself,â€ it is not self-established,

original: tshad ma nges pa med par rang gi don nges pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma nges pa med par rang gi don nges pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without the ascertainment of valid knowledge, the ascertainment of the object itself is impossible.

original: the tshom la sogs pa yul du byas pa yang ji ltar rang gi 'bras bu la ltos pa med pa yin /
analyzed: the tshom la sogs pa yul du byas pa yang ji ltar rang gi 'bras bu la ltos pa med pa yin /
translated: How is it that doubt, etc. are not without regard to their own effects?

original: chad ma gzhan gyis gzung ba la ltos nas yang ji ltar rang gi phyogs la yang thug pa med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chad ma gzhan gyis gzung ba la ltos nas yang ji ltar rang gi phyogs la yang thug pa med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And how is it that, in terms of the apprehension of another object, there is no infinite regress with regard to oneâ€™s own position?

original: de ltar na 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Thus, this is mere prattle.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i ngo bor nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid du ston pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i ngo bor nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid du ston pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, etc. shows that the reason, â€œbecause of the ascertainment of its nature,â€ is indeterminate.ğŸ”½The capacity of the nondeceptive

original: de bzhin mi slu'i nus pa yang //
analyzed: de bzhin mi slu'i nus pa yang //
translated: is also like that.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan las nges zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan las nges zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be construed with â€œis ascertained from another.â€

original: gnyi ga mtshungs zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga mtshungs zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'o //
translated: Both are similar refers to valid cognition and invalid cognition.

original: bzlog pa las zhes bya ba ni tshad ma nyid ma yin pa las so //
analyzed: bzlog pa las zhes bya ba ni tshad ma nyid ma yin pa las so //
translated: From the opposite refers to from non-valid-cognition.

original: gang yang nus pa rnams ni rtag pa'i phyir rang bzhin can ma yin la /
analyzed: gang yang nus pa rnams ni rtag pa'i phyir rang bzhin can ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, since the capacities are permanent, they are not natural.

original: dus phyis rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir rang gi rgyu dag kho na las skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus phyis rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir rang gi rgyu dag kho na las skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not depend on other causes later, it is not produced from its own causes alone.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa yang ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa yang ma nges pa'o //
translated: The potency of things is not definite.

original: de yang nus pa rnams ni rang kho na las skye ba'i phyir 'di dag ni rang bzhin can yin no //
analyzed: de yang nus pa rnams ni rang kho na las skye ba'i phyir 'di dag ni rang bzhin can yin no //
translated: Moreover, since potencies are produced from themselves alone, they are natural.

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid la rgyu rnams kyis ngo bo yod pa gang yin pa de kho na de dag gi 'bras bu la byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid la rgyu rnams kyis ngo bo yod pa gang yin pa de kho na de dag gi 'bras bu la byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, whatever essence causes have in themselves, that alone is their function in the effect.

original: dper na 'ji ba'i dum bus bskyed par bya ba'i bum pa la gzugs la sogs pa rang gi yon tan gyi kho na nas rtsom par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'ji ba'i dum bus bskyed par bya ba'i bum pa la gzugs la sogs pa rang gi yon tan gyi kho na nas rtsom par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the pot that is to be produced by the lump of clay composes its own qualities, such as form, from itself alone.

original: chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i nus pa ni bdag la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de dag gis bum pa la byed pa ma yin gyi de'i de ni rang nyid kyi skye ba yin no //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i nus pa ni bdag la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de dag gis bum pa la byed pa ma yin gyi de'i de ni rang nyid kyi skye ba yin no //
translated: Since the potency to hold water, etc. does not exist in the self, those do not function in the pot, but that is its own production.

original: de bzhin du shes pa la yang dbang po dang don la sogs pa'i de'i rgyu rnams kyis bdag nyid la byed pa'i phyir don yongs su gcod pa'i nus pa byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa la yang dbang po dang don la sogs pa'i de'i rgyu rnams kyis bdag nyid la byed pa'i phyir don yongs su gcod pa'i nus pa byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Likewise, consciousness does not have the power to comprehend its object because its causes, such as the sense faculty and object, do not act on it.

original: de'i de ni rang kho na las yin pa'i phyir des na nus pa rang bzhin can yin no zhes rlom pa de'i de ni bab col tsam yin te /ğŸ”½rigs pa @221a * //
analyzed: de'i de ni rang kho na las yin pa'i phyir des na nus pa rang bzhin can yin no zhes rlom pa de'i de ni bab col tsam yin te / rigs pa @221a * //
translated: Since it arises from itself, it has the power to arise from itself.

original: 'di tshad ma ma yin pa nyid kyang rang nyid las yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di tshad ma ma yin pa nyid kyang rang nyid las yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: This reasoning is not valid because it would follow that it arises from itself.

original: 'di ltar de ni phyin ci log gi don yongs su gcod pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la mig la sogs pa rnams ni rnam pa de lta bu'i nus pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni phyin ci log gi don yongs su gcod pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la mig la sogs pa rnams ni rnam pa de lta bu'i nus pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: This is because it is characterized by the comprehension of a mistaken object, but the eye and so on do not have the power to do that.

original: gzhan yang gal te bdag nyid la yod pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i rgyu dag gis 'bras bu la mi byed pa de'i tshe dbang po la sogs pa bdag nyid la yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar shes pa la byed /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te bdag nyid la yod pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i rgyu dag gis 'bras bu la mi byed pa de'i tshe dbang po la sogs pa bdag nyid la yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar shes pa la byed /
translated: Moreover, if causes that do not exist in the self do not produce effects, then how could faculties and so on that do not exist in the self be known?

original: yang yod pa ma yin pa de yang de dag gis byed na yongs su gcod pa'i nus pa ci'i phyir byed par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yang yod pa ma yin pa de yang de dag gis byed na yongs su gcod pa'i nus pa ci'i phyir byed par mi 'gyur /
translated: If those that do not exist are produced by them, then why would they not produce the capacity to comprehend?

original: de dag de byed pa la gegs byed pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag de byed pa la gegs byed pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no one who prevents them from producing it.

original: gzhan yang re zhig gal te dngos po las nus pa tha mi dad par khas len par byed na /
analyzed: gzhan yang re zhig gal te dngos po las nus pa tha mi dad par khas len par byed na /
translated: Moreover, if you accept that potential is not different from things,

original: de'i tshe dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du de dag kyang bdag nyid gnas pa rgyu la rag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gang las 'di dag rang bzhin can yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du de dag kyang bdag nyid gnas pa rgyu la rag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gang las 'di dag rang bzhin can yin /
translated: then like the nature of things, they would remain in their own state without depending on causes. Therefore, how could they be natural?

original: 'on te tha dad pa yin na de'i tshe rang nyid kyis 'byung ba'i phyir de dag rang gi rten dang 'brel ba grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa yin na de'i tshe rang nyid kyis 'byung ba'i phyir de dag rang gi rten dang 'brel ba grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if they are different, then since they would arise by themselves, it is not established that they are related to their basis,

original: de dag ni de la phan 'dogs par byed pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de la phan 'dogs par byed pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not benefit it.

original: phan 'dogs par mi byed pa yang rten du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phan 'dogs par mi byed pa yang rten du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that that which does not benefit is a basis,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a consequence of that.

original: gzhan yang rgyu mtshan med par rang dbang nyid kyis gyur pa yin na yang yul dang dus nges pa la ltos par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu mtshan med par rang dbang nyid kyis gyur pa yin na yang yul dang dus nges pa la ltos par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if they transform by their own power without a reason, they would not depend on a definite place and time,

original: 'di ltar gang zhig 'ga' zhig tu cung zad rag las pa'am /ğŸ”½rag ma las pa de ni de la ltos pa med pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig 'ga' zhig tu cung zad rag las pa'am / rag ma las pa de ni de la ltos pa med pa'am /
translated: because if something depends on something in some way,ğŸ”½it is not independent of it.

original: yang na ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na ma yin te /
translated: Or, if it is independent, it is not.

original: gang yang rag ma las pa rang 'ga' 'jug pa de ci'i phyir res 'ga' 'ga' zhig tu ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang yang rag ma las pa rang 'ga' 'jug pa de ci'i phyir res 'ga' 'ga' zhig tu ldog par 'gyur /
translated: If something independent transforms by itself, why would it sometimes transform in some places and not in others?

original: de lta yin dang dngos po rnams so sor nges pa'i nus pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur la gzhan du na thams cad thams cad la nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dngos po rnams so sor nges pa'i nus pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur la gzhan du na thams cad thams cad la nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, things would not possess the capacity to be individually ascertained, and otherwise, everything would be connected to everything.

original: gzhan dag ni 'bras bu yod par lta ba la brten nas /ğŸ”½tshad ma kun gyi tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'bras bu yod par lta ba la brten nas / tshad ma kun gyi tshad ma nyid //
translated: Others, relying on the view that effects exist,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa 'di brjod de /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa 'di brjod de /
translated: say, â€œThe valid knowledge of all valid knowledgeğŸ”½is the valid knowledge of the existence of the effect.â€

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu skyed par nges pa'i phyir dngos po yod pa rnams kho na rgyu dag gis byed kyis /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu skyed par nges pa'i phyir dngos po yod pa rnams kho na rgyu dag gis byed kyis /
translated: Thus, because it is ascertained that effects are produced, only existent things are produced by causes.

original: med pa nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: med pa nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa'am /
translated: Nonexistent things, such as sky flowers,

original: bye ma rnams la til mar ni gang du yang bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bye ma rnams la til mar ni gang du yang bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: or sand, are never able to perform a function.

original: med pa skyed na @221b med par khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe thams cad du skye bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: med pa skyed na @221b med par khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe thams cad du skye bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: If nonexistent things are produced, since there is no difference between nonexistent things, everything would always be produced.

original: rgyu don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is illogical because it would follow that causes would be pointless.

original: re zhig khyod kyi lugs kyis cung zad kyang med pa byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: re zhig khyod kyi lugs kyis cung zad kyang med pa byed pa ma yin la /
translated: For a while, in your system, nothing whatsoever is made.

original: yod pa yang ltos pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir cung zad kyang byar yod pa ma yin pas ci zhig byed pa na de'i byed pa por 'gyur /
analyzed: yod pa yang ltos pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir cung zad kyang byar yod pa ma yin pas ci zhig byed pa na de'i byed pa por 'gyur /
translated: And since an existent is devoid of all dependence, it does not exist as anything whatsoever. So what is it that is made? How could it be the maker of that?

original: de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, cause and effect would not exist.

original: gal te yod pa mngon par gsal bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa mngon par gsal bar byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that an existent is made manifest,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de la yang yod pa dang med pa nyid byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang yod pa dang med pa nyid byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory that an existent or a non-existent is made.

original: 'di ltar de la yang ci ste yod pa byed dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la yang ci ste yod pa byed dam /
translated: In this regard, what is it that is made?

original: 'on te med pa byed ces rnam par rtog pa 'di gnyis 'jug pa yin te ci ste yod pa byed dam /
analyzed: 'on te med pa byed ces rnam par rtog pa 'di gnyis 'jug pa yin te ci ste yod pa byed dam /
translated: This pair of conceptual thoughts occurs: Is it an existent that is made?

original: 'on te med pa byed /
analyzed: 'on te med pa byed /
translated: Or is it a non-existent that is made?

original: de la phyogs dang po la ni khyad par med pa'i phyir byed pa mi 'thad do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la ni khyad par med pa'i phyir byed pa mi 'thad do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: With regard to the first possibility, it has already been demonstrated that making is untenable because there is no difference.

original: de la yang mngon par gsal ba la brten nas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang mngon par gsal ba la brten nas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable that a non-existent entity is produced, because it is not tenable that a non-existent entity is an object of action.

original: phyogs gnyis pa yang ma yin te med pa byed par khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa yang ma yin te med pa byed par khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is the second possibility, because we do not accept that a non-existent entity is an object of action.

original: khas len na yang dngos po med pa byed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas len na yang dngos po med pa byed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you accept that, then it follows that a non-existent entity is an object of action.ğŸ”½Moreover, is the manifestation that is different from the entity the object of action?

original: gzhan yang dngos po las don gzhan du gyur ba'i mngon par gsal bar byed dam /ğŸ”½don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pa byed grang /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po las don gzhan du gyur ba'i mngon par gsal bar byed dam / don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pa byed grang /
translated: Or is the non-different object of action?

original: gal te don gzhan du gyur pa byed na de'i tshe dngos po la cung zad kyang byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te don gzhan du gyur pa byed na de'i tshe dngos po la cung zad kyang byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the different object of action is produced, then the entity would not be produced in the least.

original: gzhan byed pa na gzhan byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan byed pa na gzhan byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If the different object of action is produced, then the different object of action is not produced.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could be produced from anything.

original: de dang 'brel ba'i mngon par gsal ba gzhan byed do zhe na /
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba'i mngon par gsal ba gzhan byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the manifestation that is related to it is produced,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyis de dang 'brel ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyis de dang 'brel ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that it is related to it, since it is not something that can be benefited.

original: phan 'dogs par byed par khas len na de yang don gzhan yin na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'brel ba ma grub la /
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed par khas len na de yang don gzhan yin na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'brel ba ma grub la /
translated: If you accept that it benefits, then since that would be a different object, the absurd consequence would be that there would be an infinite regress.

original: don gzhan ma yin na yang rgyu rnams don med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gzhan ma yin na yang rgyu rnams don med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is not a different object, then the absurd consequence would be that causes would be pointless.

original: rten du gyur ba'i dngos po las phan 'dogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi mngon par gsal ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir dang dngos po'i mngon par gsal ba'i rgyu thams cad kyi tshe yod pa'i phyir rtag tu mngon sum par gsal @222a * //ğŸ”½bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½phan 'dogs par bya ba ma yin pa gzhan la ltos par yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes rnam pa mang du bstan zin to //
analyzed: rten du gyur ba'i dngos po las phan 'dogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi mngon par gsal ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir dang dngos po'i mngon par gsal ba'i rgyu thams cad kyi tshe yod pa'i phyir rtag tu mngon sum par gsal @222a * // bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // phan 'dogs par bya ba ma yin pa gzhan la ltos par yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes rnam pa mang du bstan zin to //
translated: This is because the nature of benefit is generated from the entity that is the basis, and because the cause of the manifestation of the entity exists at all times, it would follow that the manifestation would always be manifest.ğŸ”½It is also not right to rely on another that is not benefited.

original: ci ste don gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i mngon par gsal ba byed pa'i phyogs de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste don gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i mngon par gsal ba byed pa'i phyogs de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not right to take the position that the manifestation is not a different object.

original: khyad par du byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no activity that is distinct from it.

original: 'di ltar don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pa byed do zhes bya bas dngos po'i rang bzhin byed do zhes bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pa byed do zhes bya bas dngos po'i rang bzhin byed do zhes bstan pa yin la /
translated: Thus, since it is said that â€œthat which is not a different object acts,â€ the nature of things is said to act.
